story:
My name is Roxana and I'm a self-taught visual designer. Having experienced a regular 9 to 5 existence for a decade, with much of my time in front of a screen, I decided to make a shift in my life. I got to middle management twice and gave that up in both cases. I figured that it was just not for me. I am too interested in the act of creation itself. And so, I recreated my life to start fulfilling my needs and, at the same time, to feel more connected to the people around me and to the communities to which I belong.

After several personal "aha"s - that I'm very grateful for - this lifestyle shift was the basis of what has come to be the project you see now. The present campaign represents a conscious effort of gathering elements from my newly crafted existence and bringing them to life within the pages of this hardcover book.

 

If you decide to back this project, it will be a decision that has three effects:

  • You will receive an amazing piece of artwork
  • You will support an independent artist to help her transform her work into a sustainable way of making a living
  • You will donate 5% of your contribution to the children in the community of Tigman village, Palawan, Philippines

To continue my story, after deciding that I needed a change, I challenged myself: I turned my world upside down and took off by myself to travel to South East Asia. I talked with my manager, took 2 months off and went to volunteer in a small village on the astonishing island of Palawan, in the Philippine Archipelago.

Arriving all by myself in Palawan, I had the feeling of landing on a totally different planet. It was, definitely the starkest cultural difference I have yet sensed. With multi-colored tuk-tuks, staring children and unidentifiable food market produce all around me, I stepped back into myself and got to observe, from an ‘alien’ perspective, the happenings in a world so far removed from my own. The Philippines is an amazing country. The natural beauty, the culture of the native tribes, the rural idyllic space, the tens of islands, and the underwater landscape, all present one aspect. However, on the other side of the curtain, there is tension created by the current political landscape, intense poverty with repercussions on culture and education, and a growing distance between the stunning touristic locales and the reality of life for the locals.

I grabbed my pen as often as I got the chance, trying to somehow translate the reality of this place into a familiar language, to capture and store it into forever - a forever that can be shared with others as well. A gentle window into a reality that is as big as it is tiny. From cultural notes to crazy thoughts, from heart-stopping landscapes to mundane oddities or microscopical discoveries - everything went under my pen and got washed by my watercolors. Written in a freestyle manner, with absolutely no academic perspective to it, this book will reveal itself to you as a secret world, an intimate confession of what such a different reality has done to me as a human being. You will be driven by it in all possible emotional states - joy and pain, fear and lust.

 

 

 

When I thought of joining Indiegogo for bringing this project to life, I started researching what this meant. And one element that I liked most about the campaigns developed here is the transparency that the campaign authors offer about the way in which the funds will be used.

The goal of this project is to create 100 books and set them free into the world. To you. The ones who will acquire them through contributing to the featured perk.

The other perks that I have created are meant to support the publishing of this batch of 100 books or more (if you request it, we print it!). You can either choose a contribution smaller in amount than the contribution for a book - or you can go for larger contributions. By choosing a larger contribution, you decide to support me in further creating such works in my current travel to South America and in other upcoming travels (together with my baby girl and my husband). You can follow our current journey and get in touch with us here.

 

The money raised will be used to pay for:

  • the promotional video
  • campaign design materials
  • marketing and PR
  • social media promotion
  • research
  • logistics
  • book editing
  • the act of creating itself, the intellectual property defined by this final product that is the book
  • helping a young author publish her first book
  • Indiegogo taxes and payment processing fees
  • 5% (from total raised, minus shipping) donation to the children in the community of Tigman village, Palawan

Please keep in mind that this enumeration is just a short list of what the effort of bringing this project to life actually means. And, above all, I must emphasize the fact that printing a high-quality book is by no means a cheap thing to do. Also, it is very different from simply scrolling on a screen or reading it in black and white on a digital ink device. That would actually defeat the purpose of the full-color illustrations and the paper-feel of it all. Oh, and you just need to discover this world I’m talking to you about within this book - one that you can touch with your hands and feel with your eyes, mind, and heart. And all these things are beyond the material, even though they are shown to you in a paper-cardboard form.

When you will hold the book in your hands, you will notice that, beyond the original drawings - that have been minimally fine-tuned in the digital medium - and beyond the text (which is  a mix of illustration side notes, journal writings, and post-travel edits & add-ons), there’s also the visual identity of the product. Typography is an important part of it - so it is relevant to mention that the front cover typography is custom designed by me. Also, the text inside is mostly written in a handwriting font, custom-made to match my writing, especially for this book. The watercolor background of the cover was also created in analog form, with real watercolors. It was created at 4 am, on a night when I couldn’t sleep and sneaked out of bed, until baby Maya called me again. :)

As a personal note, during my pregnancy, I was intensely focused on preparing myself for birth and what that means. I have gradually discovered all sorts of taboos that our society sweeps under the carpet in relation to having a baby and giving birth. This is why I put the book project on hold and concentrated exclusively on my soon-to-be-mother experience. After baby Maya came to life, I have been working on the book on and off, dividing my attention between my human child and this intellectual offspring. I’ve done this with a lot of dedication.

 

 

The main purpose of this campaign is to get the book to you, directly to your personal library: no publishing house, no bookstore. You want it, we print it and ship it to you. As simple as that. Beyond the book, you can get perks such as a poem and artwork sent to your email, a big poster, a tote bag - you can also have an interview with me. Just go through the cute, illustrated perks below and check them out to the right side of this page, before you make your choice. Don't skip the bigger perks. Who knows, maybe you're a fan in disguise and are just finding that out now!

 

I know that we can achieve a much bigger goal together. All the perks that I have created are meant to take my creative process to another level. Every artist strives to find his or her style; A way of expressing and bringing value to the world in a unique manner, which enhances experience wherever it touches. I have found my creative spark in the mixed media form, combining illustration with writing, and sometimes also photography. The book you're about to get will show you this, and your support for me will help me to deliver it with impeccable quality. And I will continue to speak to you, my audience, in this unique language that I have discovered as a visual storyteller.

 

 

Sharing this book with you is an intimate, sensitive yet powerful confession of the world without, reflected within. It’s like a pair of glasses that I’m asking you to put on once - and maybe you’ll be inspired to wear them afterward too. This campaign is me keeping my promise to make it happen. I am so happy if I can have a book in my library, to read to Maya while she grows, for her to perceive it in all the phases - a book about a far, far away place, where she picked us and the world now. I know that my art will bring joy to your life - and that is a very serious topic. I also know that it will make you question things, it will make you look closer and choose not to pass by - and that is also a very serious topic.

And you know how they say that you need to pay it forward? Or that it would be nice to pay it forward? This I believe. I believe in giving back to the communities that have helped me grow and to the communities that have nurtured my curiosities. The way that I reached Tigman village was as a volunteered with an international volunteering organization. The program facilitates integrating into a local community and supporting them with your work, while also contributing financially to their needs - so the fee paid as a volunteer is also for the community. At the same time, you are guided by locals to comprehend their world, so you go beyond an isolated, touristic perspective of the place. The activities that I was involved in, during my stay there, were related to education and ecology.

I want to somehow provide further support to the children in Tigman village because a volunteer’s time is limited there. It involves a limited impact.  Summer school is a good tool for children in the area. By participating in these activities and interacting with the volunteers’ multiculturality, new horizons are being opened for and presented to them. But it can be a little bit more than that. So, I believe that the donations from this campaign will do that. The sum will be used to buy books and other educational materials for the children.

 

 

 

The Philippines is a wondrous country. The places that I have visited have left me with a longing to go back into the world and travel - and also with a longing to tell the story of my days spent there. It has left me with a desire revealed almost as a duty to pass on the tale of this place to you, my reader. I am here to share with you my thoughts, my inner states and all the nuances that bring us one step closer to our true core, to our real selves - unbroken by too many rules and conventions that one unintentionally follows when being born into this world.

This campaign represents a conscious effort to gather all of the above-mentioned elements in a hardcover book. A book that will reach travel aficionados, nomads, volunteer teachers, students, or people thinking about traveling and not knowing where to start their journey from. My book will act as an inspiration for you, the reader. You will find it amongst these pages - when you're looking for a magnificent moment of magic. You will also find a reminder of times spent together with people that I have met on this journey of transformation and who have now become my friends. You will perhaps feel it like a visit and a reconnection to some of your places seen and things done. This book will remind you of yourself.

 

 

With this first IndieGoGo campaign that I have created, I hope that you will help me bring this book to your coffee tables, your backpacks and your lives:

  • The book is done! It is now in the final stages of proofreading by an English native speaker and editor. Currently, I am also working on a sequel.
  • The book will get to you depending on your location on the globe. Once I am back to Romania from my current travels, I will personally take care that the printing, finishing and delivery processes go smoothly and according to high-quality standards. You can check out the visual timeline below to see when this will happen.
  • You might need to be a little bit more patient if you are in Singapore or Australia, but the book will get to you. I also want to thank you very much in advance for the fact that you agree to pay the delivery fees - these are different in each country and are quite costly for me to manage. The printing and logistics expenses are enough to be taken care of on this side.
  • If you are from Romania but are living abroad and are coming home on a regular basis, take into consideration the option of having the book delivered to you at an address in the country. I will make sure you have it then and there. (Also, let me know if you want to meet in person, and then I'll return you also the delivery fee.)

Note: the 20,000$ flexible goal is a personal choice of digits looking right on the screen. One should not be affected by this sum, as it is just a dreamy attempt to materialization. But dreams come true if you make them come true, right? Once you support my campaign, you will receive your perk, no matter if this goal is being achieved or not. So, power this project! As this project is power!

 

 

I am a 32 years old Romanian visual designer. I’ve been mostly working digitally in the past decade, in Cluj-Napoca, a beautiful town in the heart of Transylvania. I have a BA in Journalism and an MA in Advertising. I love traveling, people, animals, plants and rocks - almost everything natural found on this planet we call “home”, from sand grains to mountains. I have a dachshund dog called Frido who has been my unconditional companion - whether I’ve been in Romania or not. He is now with family, back home. I am a foodie and an amateur chef. Out of the local communities I am or have been involved in worth mentioning are the startup tech environment, the local TEDx community, the Ladies, Wine & Design community (I also founded, together with fellow creative ladies, the Cluj-Napoca chapter), and local gatherings for UI and UX professionals (user experience and user interface designers). I have worked for both local and international customers as a professional designer, in a small creative boutique kind of scenery and also in a corporate environment, with colleagues from all over the world. I am sometimes a nomad by choice, trying to travel at least 3 months per year as a lifestyle. As a fun fact, I had my publishing debut in 2012, in a collective short stories volume, entitled “Real Fictions”. I have been writing essays, editorials, poems before that and ever since - writing is a form of meditation for me, just like drawing.

Another fun fact is that I had free-hand-speed-drawn about 3 kindergarten walls, by working day and night, for an entire weekend. It was intense - I was seeing only butterflies and snails after that!

I am happy to say that I am and always have been a self-made (wo)man. After ticking off all sorts of considered-to-be achievements by the society we live in, I asked myself some questions. After some inner chatter, I went all by myself to volunteer at a kindergarten in South East Asia. There I have discovered a universe that got under my skin and into my bones. From culture and people to flora and fauna, terrestrial and aquatic - everything around me was new and so I have become a curious child all over again, absorbing everything with intensified perception -  sweet honey to my soul.

 

 

 

 

At the moment you can’t help with a financial donation? There are other ways in which you can support this project.

  • Share my Indiegogo page and let your friends know about this book
  • Talk to your friends and share the news about my new project
  • Get creative - maybe you resonate so much with the campaign that you want to become a partner, or maybe you have a hostel in Lima or Montevideo. Or you just want to throw a party with a DJ set and some delicious muffins and talk to people about this. Go wild and crazy - I sure would enjoy any support you can offer!
 

Now, I am exploring South America - this time with my husband and my baby girl - writing this very piece of text from a small hostel in Salvador, Brazil. The sequel of the book is being documented already - as writing and drawing are a regular practice. I will leave technology behind, grab the pen, the watercolors, and my drawing notebook, and I will be back - the illustrated travel journals are coming to life and you're helping me achieve that!

 

The above photos were taken in Tamadaba Natural Park. The Canary Islands, November 2018.

I have a BA in Journalism and an MA in Advertising. I love traveling, people, animals, plants and rocks - almost everything natural found on this planet we call “home”, from sand grains to mountains. I have a dachshund dog called Frido who has been my unconditional companion - whether I’ve been in Romania or not. He is now with family, back home. I am a foodie and an amateur chef. Out of the local communities I am or have been involved in worth mentioning are the startup tech environment, the local TEDx community, the Ladies, Wine & Design community (I also founded, together with fellow creative ladies, the Cluj-Napoca chapter), and local gatherings for UI and UX professionals (user experience and user interface designers). I have worked for both local and international customers as a professional designer, in a small creative boutique kind of scenery and also in a corporate environment, with colleagues from all over the world. I am sometimes a nomad by choice, trying to travel at least 3 months per year as a lifestyle. As a fun fact, I had my publishing debut in 2012, in a collective short stories volume, entitled “Real Fictions”. I have been writing essays, editorials, poems before that and ever since - writing is a form of meditation for me, just like drawing.
Another fun fact is that I had free-hand-speed-drawn about 3 kindergarten walls, by working day and night, for an entire weekend. It was intense - I was seeing only butterflies and snails after that!
I am happy to say that I am and always have been a self-made (wo)man. After ticking off all sorts of considered-to-be achievements by the society we live in, I asked myself some questions. After some inner chatter, I went all by myself to volunteer at a kindergarten in South East Asia. There I have discovered a universe that got under my skin and into my bones. From culture and people to flora and fauna, terrestrial and aquatic - everything around me was new and so I have become a curious child all over again, absorbing everything with intensified perception -  sweet honey to my soul.
 
 




 
 


At the moment you can’t help with a financial donation? There are other ways in which you can support this project.

Share my Indiegogo page and let your friends know about this book
Talk to your friends and share the news about my new project
Get creative - maybe you resonate so much with the campaign that you want to become a partner, or maybe you have a hostel in Lima or Montevideo. Or you just want to throw a party with a DJ set and some delicious muffins and talk to people about this. Go wild and crazy - I sure would enjoy any support you can offer!
 Now, I am exploring South America - this time with my husband and my baby girl - writing this very piece of text from a small hostel in Salvador, Brazil. The sequel of the book is being documented already - as writing and drawing are a regular practice. I will leave technology behind, grab the pen, the watercolors, and my drawing notebook, and I will be back - the illustrated travel journals are coming to life and you're helping me achieve that!
 

The above photos were taken in Tamadaba Natural Park. The Canary Islands, November 2018.

story:
ImaginMe is an interactive storytelling app that allows kids to do more than just read, they literally become the main character of every story. Every child can design their own 3D character, choose costumes, make decisions and become the heroes of their own adventures.

Indiegogo crowdfunding is a fantastic way for us to do three things:  1, Build awareness and create word-of-mouth for our project.  2, Develop a community of fans, users and beta-testers.  3, Raise funds to continue development and produce our interactive stories. Our goal is to launch the initial app in just a few months, but after launch, we must continue producing content. Our plan is to release a new story or game every two months after launch.

If you'd like to be a part of making ImaginMe a reality, you can help us in several ways. Back us, building and maintaining a digital app is a very expensive process. We need additional funding to complete our development and create the stories that will make up our series. Every dollar counts and we are eternally grateful for your support. Share the idea, among your friends, social and professional networks. One of the keys to a successful campaign is to attract media attention. If you know any writers, bloggers, or journalists... please introduce us!! Let's collaborate. We are always open to creative partnerships. If you would like to help us through beta-testing, sharing ideas or even partnering with us to create new ImaginMe content, our minds and ears are always open. 

ImaginMe is an intuitive, easy-to-use app that allows you to create an animated 3D character of your child in minutes. Our extensive library of faces and features is capable of creating thousands of characters. Your child's unique avatar then becomes the lead character of every story in the ImaginMe series. The 3D character is yours forever and can be updated as your child grows.

Storytelling is at the core of our vision for ImaginMe. Our stories focus on positive messages of self-reliance, creativity, confidence, equality, fun and more. Whether it's art or engineering, overcoming fears, or exploring new worlds, there are stories in development for every interest. We are teaming up with talented writers the world over with wonderful stories to tell.

ImaginMe was inspired with the goal of encouraging kids to dream big and believe in themselves. We hope that it will make a real difference in the way kids experience reading, role-playing and fun.


Thank You : To our friends & partners who have believed in us and helped us realise this project.

Anthony Calabrese, Jean Stanghellini and Thomas Carney, co-founders of ImaginMe

The entire Calabrese family

Toe, Juan, Surat & Pally and Anthony at www.deliciousvfx.com

Wesley Hsu, writer

Yix Quek, writer  http://cargocollective.com/onceuponakid

Sarah Ko, writer

Gabi Espaldon, writer

Patrick Michael Balo, writer

Seerow, Illustrator  http://www.seerow.com/

Dariuz Shah, director of photography

Marshall Smith and team at The Sound Room  www.thesoundroom.co.nz

Thananath Songchaikul (T-Ok), Executive Producer  www.bullet.pro

Lolita Ham, Executive Producer

Chonrada Chayachinda (Puk), Sound engineer

Nigel Kenneally, Executive Producer www.indigoproduction.com

Oguzcan Kaganoguzbeyoglu, AD graphic designer www.okobo.net

Tanni, graphic designer

Marcus Nelson, for that one conversation my friend.

Mom, Dad & Gus, for always believing in me. www.gowithgus.com

Thomas J Hall, partner and friend

And of course, to my amazing wife Laurence, thank you for your love and patience during this amazing journey! And to my two greatest treasures, Zoé and Aurélien.

Yours,  Ricardo Turcios

story:
The Indiegogo campaign ended, but you can still order your copy, invite me to a lecture or just donate to the Persian translation campaign because you think it's awsome. Click on the relevant language to order your copy. 
עכשיו באים? الان اومدین ها؟ ?Oh now you're coming

Since it's Flexible Funding, all the contriburots will get their perks, and some already have, in the Friday lecture in Israel and some of the T-shirts. The project will hit the road anyway with additional funds from other sources. 

And to those who wish to read what we wrote when we were young and optimistic:

The story of Esther, an integral part of the Jewish DNA, is a cultural code to be deciphered. Who knows how the characters actually spoke? The Iranist Thamar E. Gindin knows. The Book of Esther Unmasked is a linguistic, cultural and historical exegesis on Book of Esther, a masterful blend of erudite scholarship and humor, drawing directly on the original ancient Mesopotamian, Persian and Greek sources. It shows how the Book of Esther reflects intimate knowledge of the culture and language of the time, and compares it to other stories and festivals in the ancient Near East and worldwide. 

Crowdfund it now! Get your own copy and help Iranians get a free PDF!

The project Testimonials Goals Perks! About us Thanks

tl;dr — I have a PhD in Iranian linguistics.
The Book of Esther Unmasked uses the Book of Esther as an excuse to introduce Ancient Iranian culture, language and history.

Although I was born and raised in Israel and have no (known) genetic connection to Iran, I am fascinated with everything that has to do with Iran of the past 3000 years or so: people, language, society, culture and religion. I love Iran so much, I got a PhD in Iranian linguistics at 2005, supervised by Shaul Shaked, who is one of the greatest Iranists living today. Iranian linguistics means I can read Ahasuerus' original inscriptions, which I have.

Purim has always been an exciting holiday for me. The Book of Esther gives me an opportunity to talk about ancient Iran, and not only would people not frown — they would actually listen eagerly (and even pay for it)!

After 17 years of lectures, which developed tremendously over the years, I finally wrote my book last Purim. It was an intensive and exciting crowdfunding campaign on Headstart, the local platform for the Israeli market (its videos are in the gallery). The companions in this campaign chose the book's name, cover design, format, publisher's name and more.

Introducing The Book of Esther Unmasked:

Back to top

***

tl;dr — it's smart, fascinating and funny.

This is what 14-year-old Eyal Shahal wrote about my book:

The story of the Book of Esther comprises an integral part of the Jewish DNA: every girl was Queen Esther at least once, and every boy was a king or Mordechai with a cotton beard. Isaac Manger put juicy Yiddish words in the mouths of these characters, but who knows what they actually talked like? The linguist Thamar E. Gindin knows. Her Book of Esther draws directly on the original ancient Mesopotamian, Persian and Greek sources, and that, ladies and gentlemen, is fascinating. Or as Chazal put it: Did you know that the Jewish people took cultural ingredients from the gentiles and upgraded them to a flourishing and successful format which the gentiles are buying back?

The Book of Esther is a cultural code that has to be deciphered. I laughed myself to tears in the part where Thamar explains the etymologies of the names of Haman's sons. One of them was handmade, and another one was destined to be a gynaecologist! Well, we don't always live to the interpretation of our names, and this happens in the best of languages. Even Old Persian.

You can find more testimonials in our video gallery, on our Facebook page, and if you're patient enough — in the campaign video.

Back to top

***

tl;dr — I want to adapt it to English in order to reach more people,
and to Persian in order to alleviate misconceptions
spread by the current regime.

As I said, The Book of Esther Unmasked is already out in Hebrew, and this project is about publishing English and Persian editions (as well as an expanded second edition in Hebrew).

Why English? Because it's the lingua franca (common tongue) of the world today, and I want this knowledge to reach as many people as possible. My English readers will probably be adults, Jewish or of Iranian descent, but it's also suitable for brainy kids.

The English edition will be available both in print and e-book form, and as an audiobook.

Why Persian? Because the Islamic regime in Iran, and its media agencies, tell the people horrible lies about the story of Esther. The audience in my lectures rolls on the floor laughing when I tell them about this, but it's actually quite scary. Someone must show them the original text and explain the real nature of the holiday. Besides, this is yet another opportunity to expose modern Iranians to ancient Iran.


I kid you not, this is the flag that was burnt in the demonstration against "Esther and Mordechai the murderers". The flag reads: "Holocaust of 77000 Iranians".

The Persian edition is planned as a free PDF, because it's a mitzvah to unconditionally reach as many Iranians as possible. And it would have to circulate freely anyway, even if I had planned to charge for it, because it will take time for the sanctions to be lifted — and right now, Iranians within Iran can't pay internationally or receive goods from abroad.

Because of the different objectives, and because of the different backgrounds I can assume for Hebrew, English and Persian speakers, the English and Persian editions of The Book of Esther Unmasked are actually adaptations, rather than translations.

***

It will be nice to be able to pay the rent and buy food while I write these adaptations. However, the initial sum of the campaign only covers the book's expenses: printing at least 1000 copies of the Hebrew and English editions, perks, Indiegogo fees, currency conversion commissions and so on. In most cases, shipping is also figured.

If we reach 150%, the audiobook will be seriously upgraded with five Purim piyyutim by Die Drei Kantoren, the amazing Berlin-based Three Cantors — Ido Ben-Gal (tenor), Amnon Seelig (baritone) and Assaf Levitin (bass) — with their home pianist Naaman Wagner and a string quartet. Check them out!


Here they are singing songs relevant to the present time of year. 
I chose this video and not one with suits and tallit because Seelig's baby is not in them.
The piyyutim for the audiobook will be studio-recorded.

If we reach more than that, the print edition will be upgraded, too, with more pages in colour. And there's more in store!

In addition to all of this, my partner Yuval — who does all the editing, proofreading, design and layout — and I would be grateful if we can also see some blessing in our hard work (and by "blessing" we mean the dirty P word). Judging by the amount of work we had invested in our previous Hebrew books, that's quite a lot of time and effort!

What if we don't reach our goal? We promise that al contributors will get their perks, but we can't promise a free PDF in Persian, and the printed editions may be only as large as the number of contributors.

Back to top

The perks

tl;dr — books, lectures, T shirts, "mini me"s and acknowledgments

First and foremost — after all, this is why we're here: books!

  • In English: print, digital (e-book) and audio editions of The Book of Esther Unmasked.
  • In Persian: print and digital (e-book) copies of The Book of Esther Unmasked. The e-book will be distributed free of charge, but you are the ones who make it happen!
  • In Hebrew: print and digital (e-book) copies of the second, extended edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked. Print copies of the first, limited and numbered collectors' edition, are also available.
  • Our printed books come in paperback format, but ten lucky people can have them in hardcover, hand-bound by our very own Yuval Kaplan.
  • All books come complete with matching bookmarks.

In addition,
  • Dedications: you may request a personal dedication from the author. When buying in bulk, you can insert your own dedication to your guests, employees or congregation members, printed inside the book or on a sticker, depending on quantity.
  • Acknowledgements: For contributions of $127 and up, your name will appear in the acknowledgement section of the website. For contributions $511 and up, it will also appear in the acknowledgement section of the book.

Lectures

I lecture in English, Hebrew and Persian. 

  • Private lectures: I have a variety of lectures and will be happy to advise you (via Skype) on the one suitable for the occasion and audience. Please contact me directly to check my availability before choosing private lecture perks; if you contact me after paying, you'll have to settle for the dates I have available. Lectures in person are limited to countries it's safe for me to travel to (unfortunately, Iran is not one of them).
  • Local perk for Hebrew-speaking Israelis: on October 13th and 16th, I will give live lectures about women and current affairs in Iran. The lectures will take place at the beautiful studio of Chef Erez Stern. 

  • Similar lectures abroad will be announced as part of new goals we set, hopefully, as campaign goals are met and passed.
  • On three Sundays in January, I will give online lectures on the Book of Esther, each week in a different language: January 10th — Hebrew; January 17th — English; January 24th — Persian. The lectures will start at 9PM Israel time, which is evening in Europe and South Africa, night in Iran, and morning/noon in the US and Canada (sorry, Australians!). During the live lecture, you can post questions and comments in the chat, and I will answer or refer to them (almost) right away. For whoever chooses to connect after the lecture, I will post short videos with answers to later questions from time to time.

T-Shirts

T-shirts with your name in Old Persian cuneiform, handmade by my artist daughter Anati. Because they're handmade, you may choose either "Your Name" (like this T-shirt) or your actual name, in your choice of colours. You can also ask for a script or language other than Old Persian cuneiform. If it's a real language, we promise to find out how to write your name! If we can't find it, we might write something like "Net weight: 200g".

You may mix and match perks simply by adding up the values of all the perks you want and writing your full request in the comments. Well, except the local lectures and the collectors' copies of the limited Hebrew edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked, which are, as the name indicates, limited...

Karma and thank you

The real perk (that is, until the book is ready) is knowing you helped the knowledge reach as many people as possible, but we will also thank all contributors in a personal e-mail and on a daily "thank you" post on Facebook, tagging the ones we find. If you wish not to be thanked publicly, please let us know in a personal message right after contributing. If you write it in the contribution comments, we may not see it on time!

Please note: if you choose to make a higher contribution but don't write what you want in the comments, we'll just assume you're being generous and don't want anything besides the perk chosen.

A note about shipping: unless otherwise stated, the perks include regular postage to Israel, Europe (including the UK), the US and Canada. We will contact you after the campaign to see if you want other shipping options (by EcoPost, DHL, Fedex etc.), or in any case of shipment elsewhere on the globe.

Back to top

Who's on the team?

In the first crowdfunding campaign, I had one very special companion — Yuval Kaplan, who voluntarily did the design, pagination, copy editing and proofreading for the book. Only 2 mistakes have been found to date!

We went on to become partners in Zeresh Books. We've recently published another crowdfunded book: The Israeli Vegan Cookbook.

Our Iranian graphic designer and research assistant, who wishes to remain anonymous, will help us in this book too. In addition to his usual job, he will also do the copy editing of the Persian version.

Chef Erez Stern, who hosts and caters the local lectures in Israel.

Anati, my 13-year-old daughter and a multitalented artist, will make the T-shirts.

Last but not least — you! As on the Hebrew crowdfunding campaign for the first edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked, you're not only contributors but also companions. We'll set up a closed Facebook group that only companions may join, where we share bits and pieces of the book before it's published, and consult you about various issues, like new perks when we set new goals as we reach old ones. You're also in charge of sharing and letting as many people as possible know: on social media, by e-mail and in real life. The high holidays are an excellent occasion to spread the word to your friends, family and congregation, and if you have connections in the media, let them know, too!

Other ways you can help

Just contributed and want to help some more? Not interested in the subject but think we're really cool and deserve exposure? Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

Share our campaign page, our campaign videos and other videos by Thamar E. Gindin, in Hebrew, English or Persian — with a link to the campaign. You may use this short link: http://igg.me/at/zeresh.

Like, share and discuss items from our page on Facebook. You may also like our page, but liking without active engagement actually brings our page lower on people's feeds, so engagement is more important than liking!

Share my items on the High Holidays that appear on Jewish Media Agency. That's Chapter 9 in disguise!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Acknowledgements

Amir Oron, videographer and video editor, for the campaign video;

Aaron Jackson, for the narration;

Die Drei Kantoren (the Three Cantors), for their music.

Testimonials:

Eyal Shahal, a 14-year-old poet, painter, philosopher from Tel Aviv.

Ady Manory, graphic designer, Cincinnati, Ohio.

Yossi Jeff Zucker, music publisher, and Shoshana Michael Zucker, translator, Kfar Saba. 

Netanel Chlafo Brandl, IT manager, Hodayot youth village, Galilee, Israel.

In Persian: print and digital (e-book) copies of The Book of Esther Unmasked. The e-book will be distributed free of charge, but you are the ones who make it happen!

In Hebrew: print and digital (e-book) copies of the second, extended edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked. Print copies of the first, limited and numbered collectors' edition, are also available.
Our printed books come in paperback format, but ten lucky people can have them in hardcover, hand-bound by our very own Yuval Kaplan.
All books come complete with matching bookmarks.

In addition,


Dedications: you may request a personal dedication from the author. When buying in bulk, you can insert your own dedication to your guests, employees or congregation members, printed inside the book or on a sticker, depending on quantity.

Acknowledgements: For contributions of $127 and up, your name will appear in the acknowledgement section of the website. For contributions $511 and up, it will also appear in the acknowledgement section of the book.


LecturesI lecture in English, Hebrew and Persian. 
Private lectures: I have a variety of lectures and will be happy to advise you (via Skype) on the one suitable for the occasion and audience. Please contact me directly to check my availability before choosing private lecture perks; if you contact me after paying, you'll have to settle for the dates I have available. Lectures in person are limited to countries it's safe for me to travel to (unfortunately, Iran is not one of them).


Local perk for Hebrew-speaking Israelis: on October 13th and 16th, I will give live lectures about women and current affairs in Iran. The lectures will take place at the beautiful studio of Chef Erez Stern. 


Similar lectures abroad will be announced as part of new goals we set, hopefully, as campaign goals are met and passed.
On three Sundays in January, I will give online lectures on the Book of Esther, each week in a different language: January 10th — Hebrew; January 17th — English; January 24th — Persian. The lectures will start at 9PM Israel time, which is evening in Europe and South Africa, night in Iran, and morning/noon in the US and Canada (sorry, Australians!). During the live lecture, you can post questions and comments in the chat, and I will answer or refer to them (almost) right away. For whoever chooses to connect after the lecture, I will post short videos with answers to later questions from time to time.


T-Shirts
T-shirts with your name in Old Persian cuneiform, handmade by my artist daughter Anati. Because they're handmade, you may choose either "Your Name" (like this T-shirt) or your actual name, in your choice of colours. You can also ask for a script or language other than Old Persian cuneiform. If it's a real language, we promise to find out how to write your name! If we can't find it, we might write something like "Net weight: 200g".You may mix and match perks simply by adding up the values of all the perks you want and writing your full request in the comments. Well, except the local lectures and the collectors' copies of the limited Hebrew edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked, which are, as the name indicates, limited...
Karma and thank you
The real perk (that is, until the book is ready) is knowing you helped the knowledge reach as many people as possible, but we will also thank all contributors in a personal e-mail and on a daily "thank you" post on Facebook, tagging the ones we find. If you wish not to be thanked publicly, please let us know in a personal message right after contributing. If you write it in the contribution comments, we may not see it on time!
Please note: if you choose to make a higher contribution but don't write what you want in the comments, we'll just assume you're being generous and don't want anything besides the perk chosen.
A note about shipping: unless otherwise stated, the perks include regular postage to Israel, Europe (including the UK), the US and Canada. We will contact you after the campaign to see if you want other shipping options (by EcoPost, DHL, Fedex etc.), or in any case of shipment elsewhere on the globe.
Back to top

Who's on the team?
In the first crowdfunding campaign, I had one very special companion — Yuval Kaplan, who voluntarily did the design, pagination, copy editing and proofreading for the book. Only 2 mistakes have been found to date!
We went on to become partners in Zeresh Books. We've recently published another crowdfunded book: The Israeli Vegan Cookbook.
Our Iranian graphic designer and research assistant, who wishes to remain anonymous, will help us in this book too. In addition to his usual job, he will also do the copy editing of the Persian version.Chef Erez Stern, who hosts and caters the local lectures in Israel.
Anati, my 13-year-old daughter and a multitalented artist, will make the T-shirts.
Last but not least — you! As on the Hebrew crowdfunding campaign for the first edition of The Book of Esther Unmasked, you're not only contributors but also companions. We'll set up a closed Facebook group that only companions may join, where we share bits and pieces of the book before it's published, and consult you about various issues, like new perks when we set new goals as we reach old ones. You're also in charge of sharing and letting as many people as possible know: on social media, by e-mail and in real life. The high holidays are an excellent occasion to spread the word to your friends, family and congregation, and if you have connections in the media, let them know, too!

Other ways you can help
Just contributed and want to help some more? Not interested in the subject but think we're really cool and deserve exposure? Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Share our campaign page, our campaign videos and other videos by Thamar E. Gindin, in Hebrew, English or Persian — with a link to the campaign. You may use this short link: http://igg.me/at/zeresh.
Like, share and discuss items from our page on Facebook. You may also like our page, but liking without active engagement actually brings our page lower on people's feeds, so engagement is more important than liking!
Share my items on the High Holidays that appear on Jewish Media Agency. That's Chapter 9 in disguise!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
AcknowledgementsAmir Oron, videographer and video editor, for the campaign video;Aaron Jackson, for the narration;Die Drei Kantoren (the Three Cantors), for their music.Testimonials:Eyal Shahal, a 14-year-old poet, painter, philosopher from Tel Aviv.Ady Manory, graphic designer, Cincinnati, Ohio.Yossi Jeff Zucker, music publisher, and Shoshana Michael Zucker, translator, Kfar Saba. Netanel Chlafo Brandl, IT manager, Hodayot youth village, Galilee, Israel.

story:
The Open Path and Our Project

The Peace Pagoda Restoration and Retreat Center Improvement Project


Part 1: The Pagoda Restoration

The Open Path, a Center for Eastern and Western Studies, Inc, founded in 1976 is a non-profit community dedicated to the unfoldment of consciousness through meditation, the study of philosophy and the performance of charitable works.

Idaho's first and only Buddhist Peace Pagoda urgently needs restoration to continue its compassionate benefits for the present and for future generations.  The proposed work includes restoration of the pagoda as well as building a protective winter covering to prevent future damage.

The pagoda is approximately 10 miles from Boise in the Boise Front on a five acre parcel of wooded  land owned by the Open Path.

                       Peace Pagoda in 2016

                 

                                     Peace Pagoda 2016

 The Universal Peace Pagoda is a symbol and agent of transformation.  The form itself shows the path of personal liberation, beginning with the grounding of being and the creation of inner peace.  The upper shape symbolizes the channeling of personal aspiration and how to transform that into compassionate activity that benefits all sentient beings.  In addition, its structure and composition helps to channel and magnify positive energies through the skillful application of its form and relics to aid beings in their unfoldment. 

                       Peace Pagoda 1982

                  Building the Pagoda 1982


Inside the Pagoda's inner core lies precious relics of enlightened beings and sacred metal etchings of holy Buddhist scriptures.

To see the entire  Pagoda building process slide show from 1982 go to our photo gallery on the top of the page or click on the link to our Picassa slide show .

The Pagoda was built in 1982 by Open Path members under the direction of the Venerable Sayadaw U Thila Wunta, the abbot of Dat Pon Zon Monastery in Burma.  The Venerable Sayadaw was a master builder of pagodas around the world, and the Universal Peace Pagoda was his gift of "enlightened form to Western students".

Venerable Sayadaw U Thila Wunta


The Sayadaw supervising the construction of the Universal Peace Pagoda in 1982.


Now that The Venerable Sayadaw U Thila Wunta has passed, the Open Path will work with key members of the original construction team to restore the Pagoda in harmony with the designs and methods of its initial creation, to maintain the continuity of its physical and spiritual expression.

The Pagoda sits on three beautiful acres in the mountains near Boise, owned by The Open Path.

Part 2: Beyond the Pagoda: The Retreat Center Improvement Project

The second part of our project is much needed.

There is a partially constructed retreat center on the land.  Any additional $$ raised above the Pagoda Restoration Project goal will go towards siding, windows, doors for the retreat building as well as a detached privy.  Also, extra funds will be used for ongoing pagoda maintenance.

The pagoda land site also needs a privy --- just a simple one stall vault toilet. What more can we say, "When you got to go, you got to go!"

Not our actual design - but you get the idea!


The $$ Nuts and Bolts of our Project

Before we go into our $$ needs and budget, we wanted to let you know that about 350 volunteer hours will go into the Pagoda Restoration project and hundreds of volunteer hours will go in to the retreat center improvements part of the project. We are a committed group of individuals.
Here is a breakdown of our budget for the project

Pagoda Restoration
      2016                          1982
      

Materials to restore the Pagoda (concrete, protective coatings, paint...)  $3500
Protective winter covering (prevents future damage)  $1000

Pagoda Restoration/Dedication Ceremony



One of the original Buddhist teachers that worked with Sayadaw U Thila Wunta in the building of Pagoda's will be brought to Boise to ensure proper ceremony and restoration procedures are followed.
Air travel (teacher plus attendant) $1500
 14 days lodging    $2100

Total Cost for Pagoda Restoration   $8100


Retreat Center Improvements

Windows $4500
Doors $1500
Siding  $4500
Misc. Materials (i.e., caulking, nails, lumber, insulation, flashing, building wrap ......) $2000

Privy (Vault toilet):
Poly vault, concrete slab, risers, vents $2200
Soil Grading and delivery $470
Material for bathroom  building over vault (lumber, siding, roofing, vent pipe, hardware, nails) $1450
Total Cost for Retreat Center Improvement $16,620

Total Cost for Both Pagoda Restoration and Retreat Center Improvements $24,720


Timeline

The Pagoda Restoration will begin and should be completed in  2016.
The Retreat Center Improvement Project will begin in 2016 and should be completed by 2017. Due to snow conditions work can only be completed late Spring through Fall.


Our "Thank You" for your support

Here are a few special perks we would like to share when you become part of our Pagoda stewardship community.

Beautiful Pagoda and Buddhist postcards, a handmade blessed rosary, an invite for a Peace Pagoda Tour with meditation and gourmet lunch, personal Thank You on a  beautiful pagoda postcard, and many blessings for a loved one!


Why support Our Project

Your act of generosity will help preserve a precious Buddhist monument -- in our own backyard -- and make you part of something bigger than one's self.

This Pagoda is a sacred relic that is the venerable Sayadaw's gift of "enlightened form" to all of us in the West.  Become part of our care stewardship team!!!

Also, improvements to the retreat center will allow the building to be usable for events at the Pagoda land site!!

May your contribution create happiness and compassion for yourself and all beings!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone has the capability to donate $$  to our project .........But you can still help us out!

  1. Share our story and campaign with your Facebook friends
  2. Email your personal friends and tell them about our Pagoda Project
  3. Keep our project in your prayers and meditations
May your day be filled with peace!

story:
MY NAME IS GEORGE CONNOLLY. IN 2010 I WROTE A BOOK CALLED

NATIONAL HEALTH LOTTERY. IT IS A NEW WAY TO FUND HEALTH INSURANCE.

I WROTE THE BOOK AFTER HAVING MY HEALTH INSURANCE RATES RAISED

FOUR TIMES THE ORIGINAL AMOUNT IN MY BUSINESS FOR MYSELF AND MY EMPLOYEES DUE TO A COBRA ERROR.

I AM IN THE AUTO COLLISION BUSINESS. I STARTED TO WONDER WHY

AUTO INSURANCE WAS SO SUCCESSFUL AND HEALTH INSURANCE

WAS FAILING. DID YOU KNOW THAT THERE ARE HUNDREDS OF

AUTOMOBILE INSURANCE COMPANIES AND ONLY A HANDFUL OF HEALTH INSURANCE COMPANIES.

I KEPT ASKING MYSELF IF HEALTH  INSURANCE IS SO PROFITABLE WHY WASN'T ALL THE AUTO INSURANCE COMPANIES INVOLVED IN HEALTH INSURANCE.

 SO I COMPARED THE TWO AND FOUND A WAY FOR HEALTH INSURANCE TO ACT LIKE AUTO INSURANCE.

SO YOU CAN READ MY BOOK FOR FREE. IF YOU LIKE MY IDEA YOU CAN CHOOSE

ONE OF THE PERKS. THE MONEY WILL BE USED TO RUN RADIO ADS

 TO HELP PROMOTE THIS NEW SYSTEM OF INSURING ALL OF US.

JUST CLICK ON THE WEBSITE TAB BUTTON BELOW  .

THIS WILL BRING YOU DIRECTLY TO OUR WEBSITE TO READ BOOK.

http://www.nationalhealthlottery.com

ENTER FREE CODES

USERNAME nhl212

password     nhl212

REMEMBER ITS FREE TO READ AND IF YOU THINK IT IS A GOOD IDEA

THEN PLEASE CHOOSE ONE OF THE PERKS.

IN 2010 I WENT TO WASHINGTON AND HANDED OUT 250 COPIES

TO EVERY SENATOR AND CONGRESSMAN I COULD TO NO AVAIL.

THIS HAS TO COME FROM THE PEOPLE LIKE YOU AND ME.

 I NEED YOUR HELP TO DRAW ATTENTION TO A SYSTEM

THAT COULD HELP US ALL.


JUST A LITTLE PHOTO OPT TO GIVE YOU AN IDEA OF HOW PART

OF THE SYSTEM WOULD WORK. WATCH BOTH VIDEOS

PART 1 AND PART 2  AND READ THE BOOK FOR FREE

TO GET A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE

WHOLE SYSTEM WOULD  WORK ITSELF RIGHT

INTO OUR EXISTING SYSTEM.

ONE OF THE WAYS MONEY WOULD BE DISPERSED

GO TO GALLERY SECTION AND SEE OTHER OPTIONS.

 CHOOSE WHICH ONE YOU LIKE BEST OR LET ME KNOW IF

YOU HAVE A BETTER IDEA. 

http://www.nationalhealthlottery.com

story:
Short Summary

At a transitional age when many children start to let go of a magical world-view and their imaginations become hobbled with the restrictions of reality, young Lily inadvertently finds herself on the adventure of a lifetime after she is literally swept into the ocean. The transitional process is represented in the story by Lily’s being forced to move from an idyllic life in a ‘cottage by the sea’ to ‘the city’ which represents all that is grown-up and non-magical. Yet, thanks to Lily’s adventure on the night before her family’s departure, she will carry with her an unshakeable belief and connection to the fairy-tale world where anything is possible and where mermaids really do exist. The story also carries a message about the pride and arrogance of people who do not heed the warnings of the natural world, and a lesson that true faith can work miracles.

The setting for the story is the undersea realm of King Neptune. The title Neptune’s Tale refers to Neptune’s explanation to Lily of where mermaids come from, and his story of the demise of Atlantis.

Neptune’s Tale is aimed at ages 3 through 6 - 7 and is intended as an illustrated storybook, with illustrations by Artist Leith Ridley-Combe according to the style the author envisaged.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need funding to have this book published as a hardcover book with colour illustrations. To make it viable we'd need to order 100 copies from a print-on-demand publisher, and for this we need around $1000  - the equivalent of R10 000 in South Africa, where the author resides and where we will have it published and printed.
  • We are offering  a signed printed hard-cover copy of a beautiful children's book, with an acknowledgement in the acknowledgement page to each contributor - but this will cost quite a bit, so we can only offer it to those who contribute $50 - it's a lot I know. This is not a cheap book to print.
  • Though this story  is intrinsically about the innocence of childhood, faith and the belief in magic, it is also set in the sea, and based on a love of the ocean. It is written by  someone fortunate enough to live in a place (Plettenberg Bay in South Africa) where you can hear the song of humpback whales echoing around the bay in the still early hours. If we (and by we I mean myself and my sister who is an artist, and who did the illustrations for me) do not achieve our funding target, the collected funds will go to Sea Shephard - the 'pirates' who have dedicated their lives to the welfare  and future of whales and dolphins...and the ocean....so that others may hear the eerie sounds of humpbacks long into the future.

The Impact

I wrote this story for my own daughter when she was three years old, and I think that it’s worth something; worth enough to go public and ask for help from people out there who might really enjoy it.

The people I’m looking for are those who have children aged 2 to 7, or who have family and friends with children aged 2 to 7. People with open minds - who embrace magic, wonder, faeries and other silly things, people who believe in God or Gaia and all other wondrous possibilities, who love the ocean, animals, innocence, children and adventure; people who remember their childhoods, when they believed in the Tooth Fairy and the Easter Bunny…and their parents didn’t feel guilty for letting them do so. People who believe a seagull might talk and a dolphin might rescue a child from a wild sea, sea monsters might eat stricken sailors, mermaids might exist…and everything that might be is still mighty real in the mind of a child.

I thought of publishing this as an e-book, but it didn’t feel right. I might still (one has to keep with the times), but what I really envision and want is exactly why I am looking for crowd-funding – the expensive option: A hardcover book with colour illustrations that a child can read (or their parent read to them) while they are holding it, running their hands over the illustrations, the book on their lap as they lie under a cosy divan in their warm, safe bedroom. Then mommy, or daddy, leaves the room, switches off the night-light, says goodnight…and they drift off to sleep…to swim with the dolphins, visit whales, meet fish and fairies and makes necklaces of bubbles under the sea.

In the morning, they wake with their heads, hearts and souls filled with adventure – the kind of magical wonder and possibility we tend to forget as adults. The book is on the nightstand, or maybe it has fallen to the floor – to be picked up again, to be kept, to be read again or kept on a bookshelf or a box in the attic for their own children to read one day.

Risks & Challenges

One challenge is to reassure all potential investors that the project is genuine; that it will go ahead if our target is reached and that they will receive their perks. To this end, we promise full financial transparency...and honesty.

The other challenge is sales! Once we get the book printed, we need to market it and sell it, and to this end we welcome all suggestions and invite all investors to share news of their investment on Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms, with friends, family and associates - especially those with children!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this campaign, but you cannot contribute, please spread the word...

People who believe a seagull might talk and a dolphin might rescue a child from a wild sea, sea monsters might eat stricken sailors, mermaids might exist…and everything that might be is still mighty real in the mind of a child.
I thought of publishing this as an e-book, but it didn’t feel right. I might still (one has to keep with the times), but what I really envision and want is exactly why I am looking for crowd-funding – the expensive option: A hardcover book with colour illustrations that a child can read (or their parent read to them) while they are holding it, running their hands over the illustrations, the book on their lap as they lie under a cosy divan in their warm, safe bedroom. Then mommy, or daddy, leaves the room, switches off the night-light, says goodnight…and they drift off to sleep…to swim with the dolphins, visit whales, meet fish and fairies and makes necklaces of bubbles under the sea.
In the morning, they wake with their heads, hearts and souls filled with adventure – the kind of magical wonder and possibility we tend to forget as adults. The book is on the nightstand, or maybe it has fallen to the floor – to be picked up again, to be kept, to be read again or kept on a bookshelf or a box in the attic for their own children to read one day.
Risks & Challenges
 One challenge is to reassure all potential investors that the project is genuine; that it will go ahead if our target is reached and that they will receive their perks. To this end, we promise full financial transparency...and honesty.
The other challenge is sales! Once we get the book printed, we need to market it and sell it, and to this end we welcome all suggestions and invite all investors to share news of their investment on Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms, with friends, family and associates - especially those with children!
    Other Ways You Can Help If you like this campaign, but you cannot contribute, please spread the word...

story:
Lives and stories

I'm Vivian Blaxell, professor of Japanese and Asian Studies, researcher, writer, and contributing editor for the Asia Pacific Journal: Japan Focus. In the nearly 40 years I've been teaching, speaking and writing about Japan's empire and occupations in Asia I've come across some horrific things, but nothing haunts me more than the untold stories of men and women from South East Asia displaced and ruined by the empire, shipped far from home, and stranded for the rest of their lives without anybody knowing about it. For years I've been trying to track these tragic stories down and bring them into the light. I've had some success with the stories of Kim Soon-ae (Mariam Johari) and Karja Wiredja, and I've presented my account to a major conference in Chicago last March. But more work needs to be done.

Here is what I know so far: 

In 2007, Kim Soon-ae was an 86-year old woman living in Seoul, Korea. In 1943, she was Mariam Johari, a 22 year-old Malay single mother with three small children living in Plentong, a small town in Johor just across the strait from Singapore.  In May 1943, Japanese soldiers abducted her. They forced her to work building an airfield. In the labor camp, Kim met a Korean soldier in the Imperial Japanese Army. They fell in love, and after the war ended, she ended up with him in South Korea without papers. For more than 60 years Kim was stranded and almost entirely invisible. Her three children in Malaya presumed her dead.  Then, chance intervened. Her story became public and she was able to see her children, now old and gray themselves, again before she died. 

Yet, Kim Soon-ae turns out to be just one of perhaps 1,000 women from Southeast Asia in relationships with soldiers in the Imperial Japanese Army, some of them with children, who were shipped off with their partners after Japan surrendered. The fates of these women and their children and have vanished from our consciousness. This project throws long overdue light on Kim and the other women and their children who ended up far from home, stateless and unseen because of their relationships with imperial Japanese army personnel. 

In 2011 a Japanese charity in Bangkok discovered Karja Wiredja living in rags in a remote community near Thailand's border with Myanmar. 65 years earlier he had been taken away from his home in Indonesia to work on the notorious Thai-Burma railroad. When Japan's empire in Asia collapsed in 1945, Karja was left stranded, impoverished and stateless in Thailand. The Japanese charity returned Karja to his small hometown in central Java but it was too late: his family had vanished and people could barely understand his way of speaking the local language. Karja is just one of hundreds of thousands of men from Southeast Asia who were taken far from home, forced to work on Japan's imperial projects, and never returned after the war ended. This project seeks these vanished men in Borneo, the Andaman Islands, and in northern Thailand, and brings their lives and their stories into the light at last.

Nothing tells us more about the long term, ongoing effects of Japan's empire and occupations in Asia than the unseen lives of the ordinary people the empire moved, used, ruined, and then left stateless and washed up on some foreign shore. Women like Kim Soon-ae and men like Karja Wiredja deserve to have their stories brought into the light, to have them told, to have their lives remembered and recorded. Your support of part 2 alive  the undead empire helps to redress the injustice of silence. 


Needs, tasks, and rewards

Join me in completion of the research and writing for this part of the much larger project : the undead empire | reports from Japan's colonies in Asia, a mixed travel/memoir/academic book visiting and exploring the long-term effects of Japan's empire and occupations. To learn more about :the undead empire, visit www.undeadempire.com. 

$5,000 ($2,500 for airfares and other travel costs; $2,500 for 14 days of living expenses) supports travel to London and Amsterdam and research in the UK National Archives and the Netherlands Institute for War Documentation where records of displacement and repatriation of women and men like Kim Soon-ae and Karja Wiredja are kept. 

$3,000 ($1,600 for airfare; $1,400 for living costs) supports travel to Port Blair, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India, and field research with Dr. Rashida Iqbal, Curator of the National Memorial Cellular Gaol in Port Blair. The aim of the work here is to track the fates of 600-1,000 Malay and Javanese slave laborers for the empire who were not repatriated to their homelands.

$2,000 ($1,000 for airfares; $1,000 toward daily expenses) supports meetings and interviews in the Philippines and Taiwan with the children and grandchildren of Japanese and Taiwanese soldiers in the Imperial Japanese Army who had children with Filipinas and with women in Singapore, Malaya and Indonesia.

$500 to cover fundraising costs.

Rewards for your support include special :undead empire bookmarks and postcard collections created using vintage Japanese postcards from the time, digital and/or hard copies of :the undead empire | reports from Japan's colonies in Asia book when it is published in 2017, and prominent recognition of your support in both versions of the book. Most importantly, your contribution to the alive stage of the project carries with it the reward of knowing you have helped shine light on a tragic and yet mostly unknown part of the recent past. 

This is a flexible funding campaign. If the campaign does not reach the entire goal of AUD$10,500, any campaign funds will be used to support research in London and Amsterdam first, then in Port Blair, and lastly in the Philippines and Taiwan.

Rest assured, the project will be completed no matter what the outcome of this campaign.


The impact

As a professor of Japanese and Asian Studies, I have a long track record of bringing research and writing projects to completion and publication. In the last few years, I have published a number of articles at Asia-Pacific Journal: Japan Focus, where I am also a contributing editor, who must help other writers complete their projects. I know how to do what needs doing.

Focused on the forgotten tragedies of human experience in Japan's empire, alive: the undead empire part 2  is a key part of the larger : the undead empire project, which not only transforms our stories about Japan's empire and occupations in Asia, it also makes these stories personal and readable without surrendering intellectual rigor. The entire :the undead empire | reports from Japan's colonies in Asia project represents the culmination of my many years of study, travel and thinking, but for the people still affected by the empire, the project represents recognition of their lives.

 

Risks  and challenges

Let me be completely honest: there is a chance that my research work will uncover nothing except an absence of records. There is a chance, too, that the records I do find may lead into dead ends. Even so, all will not be lost. I have already mapped and written about the stories of Kim Soon-ae and Karja Wiredja, and if my efforts to track the stories of other men and women come to nothing, then that coming to nothing will be the story. "Absence" does not mean "nothing."


Other ways you can help

I know you might not have enough money to contribute to the campaign, or that you might just prefer to not contribute financially. But you can help me bring the stories of people uprooted and stranded by the Japanese Empire into the light by sharing this alive: the undead empire part 2 crowdfunding campaign with absolutely everybody on your social network and email lists. Use the Indiegogo share tools or this URL: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/alive-the-un...

story:
Our new campaign is up and running at http://igg.me/at/CanadianVeteransABC/

Thank you all for the support! 


Until recently, Canada’s government took care of the Canadian veterans who defended our values of freedom and democracy.

But with Stephen Harper and the Conservatives in power, our heroes stand alone.

You see, the Conservatives turned their backs on our veterans.

The Harper Conservatives argued in court they have “no moral obligation to our veterans” who they sent into war zones.

The Conservatives spent $750,000 of taxpayers’ money to fight the legal rights of soldiers to get proper compensation for their injuries.

I’m sure you agree with us that our vets deserve dignity.  They deserve respect. You already know that many vets came home injured.  Wounded. And yet the Conservatives closed nine frontline offices that helped these brave men and women.

What we will do

We are running a national campaign to encourage voters to defeat the Conservatives. 

We are organizing veteran volunteers and supporters in communities across Canada. We will use Facebook, our website and our large contact list to mobilize on the anti-Conservative vote on Election Day.  And we will be in the media regularly – challenging the Conservatives.

Why your donation is so important

Our digital presence will be extensive.  In one week of testing we reached more than two million people!  A $100 donation will get a support-our-veterans message to 20,000 people. 

This issue resonates with voters. Our Facebook posts have spread like wildfire.

That’s why your donation is important. You’ll help us to reach every voter. Because we need to get our videos and TV ads on air. And we need to raise the money to buy airtime. Your donation is valuable and a sign of your care for our vets, and our country’s future.

Please…

Think about what Canada means to you. 

Then think about how great it would be to see the appalling Harper Conservatives tossed out of power. 

Canadians recognize that the Harper government abused vets.

We feel the Conservatives should lose the election, in part, because of their horrible treatment of Canada’s heroes.

Help us to reach all Canadian voters and tell them the truth about the Harper Conservatives. You can do this when you make a donation to this campaign.

Who we are

In 2014 a group of veterans started a national organization. We call it: Anyone But Conservative (ABC) - Canadian Veterans Campaign 2015.  Since last year many vets, family members and friends have joined us. We hope you will too.

We are ready to fight against the Conservatives and to fight for our veterans.

How you can help

Here's our plan.

We will use a combination of on-the-ground work in swing ridings, digital campaigning and media coverage.

During the election, we will organize veterans to speak out publicly, to the media, and to their friends.

Your donation will help to get organizing kits, signs, and campaign materials into veterans hands.

Your donation of $10, $100, $1,000 or more will help us to defeat the Harper Conservatives.  Please donate right now. So much is at stake.

Why your action today is critical

In the past 10 years, the Harper Conservatives have:

  • Stripped away the right of modern-day disabled veterans to collect a lifetime pension;
  • Closed nine veteran support offices and slashed 900 jobs while increasing the department’s political advertising budget of $4.5 million; 
  • Denied counseling support at a time when more Canadian soldiers have died by suicide than were killed in action in Afghanistan.

Will you support our plan to help defeat the Conservatives in the federal election on Monday, Oct 19th? 

Your donation will help us reach enough people to remove the Conservatives from office.

Veterans have fought to protect our county. Now it’s your opportunity to fight for them.

Help support vets with a donation now.

“We have a national suicide rate now in the Canadian armed forces that’s unbearable. And there’s no place to go.”

-  Vincent Rigby, served 22 years in the Canadian armed forces

With your help, Harper can be stopped. With your help, more Canadian veterans’ lives can be saved. With your donation today, you can change your country, for the better.

A personal message from Ron Clarke 

“My name is Ron Clarke and I’m 75 years old. I served in the Canadian armed forces for 36 years. I retired with a back problem and later was diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

“Before the Harper cuts, the Veterans Affairs Office was always there to support me with my physical and emotional needs. They saved my life when I didn’t know if I could carry on".

“Now the office has been forced to close by the Harper government. I have nowhere to go. No one to see to help me".

“I know I’m not the only one. Veterans like me across Canada are desperate for help. Suicide rates amongst the Canadian armed forces are at an unprecedented rate. If we don’t do something now I fear greatly for our future".

“I was always a Conservative voter, but never again.”

“Will you help us defeat the Conservatives? Will you please make a donation today?”

-  Ron Clarke,  served 36 years in the Canadian armed forces

How you can get involved

1.  Make a donation today.

2.  Give us your email address so we can send you updates on volunteer opportunities and rallies in your community. Visit our website. www.veteransagainstconservatives.com

3.   Join our Facebook page, email this page to your friends, and post it on social media. https://www.facebook.com/VoteABC2015 

On Election Day, an increasing number of Canadian veterans will vote against the Conservative candidate in their riding. Please join them.

Imagine on Election Day that the Harper Conservatives go down to defeat.  Now imagine your donation to this campaign helped to remove them from power. You’ll feel fantastic!

www.veteransagainstconservatives.com

Authorized by: Canadian Veterans ABC Campaign 2015

Per Elections Canada : “Individuals who are Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada, and businesses  or other organizations that operate in Canada, can make contributions to a third party for election advertising purposes”.

story:
Victims of Bullying Need Help and Healing

Victims of bullying in middle school and/or high school often enter college or the workforce with unresolved anger, depression and low self-esteem from the abuse they suffered.  Names Will Never Hurt Me: Healing for Victims of Bullying, will help young adults who were victimized find hope and healing. 

Names Will Never Hurt Me: Healing for Victims of Bullying will help victims by:

1.  Validating their pain.

2.  Illustrating how the psychological damage from the trauma can sabotage their career and relationships if not dealt with.

3.  Help them find healing from the trauma and provide a road map to create the life they desire.

My story will be introduced in the first chapter.  I was the victim of bullying for nearly 10 years beginning in third grade through my senior year in high school.  As a young adult, I was angry, bitter and struggled with low self-esteem and bouts of depression.  

It took another ten years after leaving the bullying behind for me to find healing and develop a better foundation for dealing with life.  Now, I want to help other victims.

Help publish this book and reach out to these victims.

The next steps include editing, layout, printing, marketing and publicity.

The ultimate goal isn't just selling books.  My goal is to speak at high schools, colleges and community groups.  I will bring attention to the long-term damage that bullying causes, and help other victims with their issues. My story will be used to show them that there is hope for a better future. I’ll listen to their struggles and help them begin the healing process.

The total I am seeking is $6600, which will go to:

  • Developmental editing - $800
  • Copy editing - $400
  • ISBN numbers - $250
  • Professional Reviews - $450
  • Website design - $500
  • Printing 1000 copies and shipping - $2200
  • Marketing & Publicity - $2000

Perks Offered

There are three levels of perks offered to those who help get this book published.  Those who donate:
  • $25 - electronic copy of the book
  • $50 - electronic copy and a signed print copy of the book
  • $100 - both of the above perks, plus a three week online seminar designed to help you get beyond obstacles from the past and create the life you desire.
I need approximately $4000 to get the book published and print 1000 copies.  The remainder of the funds I'm seeking will allow me to hire people to help with marketing and publicity.  If I reach the smaller goal, I can still publish the book and seek alternative methods to market the book.

I've Been Where These Victims Are:

My experience as a victim, and a person who overcame the trauma make me uniquely qualified to help other victims.  I learned better ways to deal with the past, and how to create a  better future.

Challenges

Getting a book noticed with so many titles being published every year can be a difficult task.  Bullying is currently a very hot topic in the media and in schools around the country.  Right now, there aren't a lot of books written to help the victims after they leave the bullying behind.  I will fill a niche that is currently wide open.

I also have contacts at several local universities and in local media outlets  These contacts will allow me to get speaking opportunities, and help me get interviews at local TV stations and radio stations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, you can still help by:

  • Spreading the word, especially using social media, email and word of mouth .
  • You can share on most social media platforms by clicking on the Indiegogo share tools!
