story:
Short Summary


  • Shamar Hill is a single father to a 6 year old son. He has been working on a poetry collection, Photos of an Imagined Childhood for almost 2 years. His work has been published in The American Reader and he has been the recipient of fellowships from the New York Foundation of the Arts, JP Morgan Chase Foundation and the Department of Cultural Affairs of New York City. He has taught at Cooper Union, CUNY, NYU and the New School.
  • Shamar was accepted to the Bread Loaf Writers Conference which will take place August 12-22, 2015 in Middlebury, VT. However, the tuition (plus the room and board) is $3,050. As a single father this is a lot of money for Shamar. Whether you can give one dollar or a lot more, it will be appreciated. If 117 people give $30, Shamar can meet his goal.


What We Need & What You Get

  • If Shamar reaches the goal of $3,500 , it will pay for the tuition, room and board to attend Bread Loaf. Any additional funds will cover travel to Middlebury, VT.

    If you give $30, you will receive a personalized sampler chapbook from the collection Photos of an Imagined Childhood

    If you give $50, you receive a 1-hour consultation on a manuscript of 5 poems.

    If you give $100, you receive two 1-hour consultations and the sampler chapbook.

    If you give $300, Shamar will lead a 3-hour workshop for up to 10 participants in New York City or New Jersey. 

  • If Shamar doesn't reach his goal of raising $3,500, then he will still use the funds to attend Bread Loaf.

The Impact

Attending Bread Loaf will give Shamar the opportunity to receive feedback on his first manuscript from esteemed writers: Terrance Hayes, Tom Sleigh, Edward Hirsch, Afaa Michael Weaver, and Ellen Bryan Voigt.   Shamar will also  attend readings, lectures, and presentations by faculty, editors, and literary agents.  Attending this conference would allow him to improve the manuscript, work with great writers, and network with agents and editors. This amazing opportunity would help Shamar get his manuscript finished and published. It would be a huge step for him to realize his dream of being published writer since he was a thirteen year old boy.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are tools to share this indiegogo page, so please use them!

Post/share this fundraising effort on Facebook, email, with colleagues and friends.

Tweet about this fundraising effort and include @shamar_hill so he can retweet you!

story:
Summary

Ursula Richter spent the past 32 years volunteering in Brazil. She walked away from her comfortable life in Canada to change the lives of hundreds of children. Give her the chance to tell her story.

  • This funding will allow me, her nephew, to fly to Brazil and ghostwrite her book.
  • She has encountered many miracles in her life and has shown what it means to live by faith.
  • Her story needs to be shared to inspire others.

What We Need & What You Get

This funding will allow me to spend three months writing the first draft of her book in Brazil. I will be shadowing her everyday and interviewing the people whom she impacted.

  • A round-trip flight costs $1,500.
  • My expenses in Brazil will be about $1,400 a month.
  • You will get a signed, hardcover first-edition of the book.
  • You can have your name appear on the acknowledgements page.
  • You get to share my journey as I spend two-full months with her and her organization.
  • You get special VIP admission to the feature film that is currently being made about her.
My flight takes off on August 20th, and I am fully committed to raising this amount before I leave. As a recent graduate, I have not yet settled down in Canada, and am willing to fly to Brazil to spend time with Ursula and record her story. I know how profound her story is and am confident it will inspire others.

The Impact

Your contribution will allow Ursula's story to be shared with future generations. In the words of one volunteer, "Ursula is like a saint" and has dedicated her life to serving others. We hope to set an example for the value of service and following one's passion.

  • In 2012 I first met Ursula and went to Brazil to volunteer for her.
  • The next year, a Canadian film-crew went to Brazil to make a documentary film about her children's home (trailer here)
  • For the past several decades, contributions from North America and Europe have allowed her children's home to expand to its current size (over 30 staff and 190 children).
  • This book will preserve her story, and will be used for future fundraising efforts.

Challenges

At 70 years old, Ursula wants to write her story before it is too late. While she is trilingual (English, German and Portuguese), her written English is not proficient.

  • After the first-draft of the book is done, it will continue to be edited in Canada.
  • We will launch Phase II of the campaign in the fall to pay for publishing costs.
  • If we do not reach our fundraising goal, the trip may have to be postponed.
  • Please share this with anyone you think is interested!

Other Ways You Can Help

Learn more about Ursula's story at www.ursulaschildrenshome.com

  • Please contact Justin directly if you would like to donate a different amount or help out in another way.
  • These books will make great gift items!

About the Author

Justin Brokop is a Leadership Consultant in the Vancouver area and has been a passionate author since he started his first journal in 2006. He has consulted for clients internationally, helping them grow their business and create a lifestyle of purpose. His mission is to help people focus on what is most important and to create actionable, specific steps to implement that on a daily basis.

We expect the first published copy to be available in 12-18 months. Thank you for your contribution!

Please share this with anyone you think is interested!
    Other Ways You Can Help Learn more about Ursula's story at www.ursulaschildrenshome.com  Please contact Justin directly if you would like to donate a different amount or help out in another way. These books will make great gift items!

About the AuthorJustin Brokop is a Leadership Consultant in the Vancouver area and has been a passionate author since he started his first journal in 2006. He has consulted for clients internationally, helping them grow their business and create a lifestyle of purpose. His mission is to help people focus on what is most important and to create actionable, specific steps to implement that on a daily basis.
We expect the first published copy to be available in 12-18 months. Thank you for your contribution!

story:
Hi. My name is Jari "Sojari" Bradley and I am a queer woman of color, broke college student, and spoken word artist. Out of a great number of applicants,I have recently been accepted to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop. I am now trying to get to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop which takes place May 31st- June 13th at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. You can find out more about Callaloo and its distinguished creative writing program here: http://callaloo.tamu.edu/2015-CCWW-USA
I need to reach my goal by May 28th, which is a very short amount of time. And while this is an incredible honor and a huge opportunity, I am not currently able to afford what it costs to make the trip as a broke college student. I've been spread pretty thin with the work of finishing my senior year as a Sociology major at San Francisco State University, getting things ready for graduation,  preparing myself for Graduate School, and other community-oriented projects (like coaching the Mills College CUPSI Slam Team). This is where I need your help and the help of my community, as it is important to invest in the lives and voices of working poor writers of color so that they may have access to spaces such as these. What you are able to contribute is not only about me realizing my own personal goals, but it is also a contribution to black voice in a time where violence committed against bodies that resemble my own are prevalent nationwide. I seek to utilize my voice in collaboration with other writers of color as a means of resistance, and my participation in Callaloo would greatly assist in that endeavor. 


What I Need

1 Round Trip Flight: $521.20 

Room & Board: $1700


What You Get

A $1 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter!

A $5 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter + a pdf version of a poem you select!

A $10 donation gets you all of the above + a pdf of my chapbook!

A $25 donation gets you all of the above + a signed and printed copy of my chapbook!

A $50 donation gets you all of the above + a handwritten thank you from Callaloo!

A $75 donation gets you all of the above + a digital download of my mixtape of original songs and poems entitled: Ascension

Risks & Challenges

As a queer woman of color writer, it is also not common for a voice like mine to be celebrated and upheld in mainstream discourse around socioeconomic inequity and police violence against black and brown bodies. My work as a writer, academic, and community leader is centered on making the conversation around black bodies and queer bodies of color more accessible and transparent despite the various obstacles set in place via oppression, racism, sexism, and homophobia. 

Coming from meager means, it is hard to come up with enough money on my own to take this opportunity that has been afforded to me. So without community support, I won't be able to attend Callaloo. But with your help, I can guarantee this opportunity will help me grow in my work immensely. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please just share the link to the campaign! It helps just as much as donating!

story:
UPDATE! (08.04.15) - THE CAL WILD CHRONICLES spans 30 years of Gene O'Neill's writing career. To help celebrate, four incredible writers of the various genres these books traverse have been selected to write introductions for the four books in the series. When this campaign reaches 50% funding, the four names will be announced!

Help bring Gene O'Neill's colorful world of Cal Wild to life in trade paperback! 

Starting in winter of 2015 with THE CONFESSIONS OF ST. ZACH, Written Backwards will release a new trade paperback volume of The Cal Wild Chronicles by Gene O'Neill each quarter, continuing with THE BURDEN OF INDIGO in spring of 2016, followed by THE NEAR FUTURE in summer, and concluding with THE FAR FUTURE in the fall.

Each beautiful book will be a high-quality trade paperback with a matte finish cover designed by GAK, and with illustrations throughout. The front covers will be designed to create a larger panoramic image if aligned side-by-side, and the back covers will do the same. As more funds are raised during this campaign, more stretch goals will be announced, including more interior illustrations (perhaps in color), and more books for those who contribute! Scroll below for stretch goals.

If the fourth stretch goal is reached, that means for only $25 you get a copy of a CAL WILD book of your choice, signed by the author, along with a signed copy of AT THE LAZY K, and your choice of any Written Backwards title. Or, if you go the 4-book route, that means for only $100 you get a copy of all four books in the CAL WILD series, signed by the author, along with a signed copy of AT THE LAZY K, and your choice of any Written Backwards title.

UPDATE! (07.18.15) - All contributors of the 4-book or higher options of this campaign ($100-500) get 3 books from the Written Backwards library (instead of just the 1). So, if you include AT THE LAZY K, this gets you 8 book total for $100 or more, plus other options as they become available. The sponsorship options toward the end get you the most perks. $500 gets you everything within this campaign, along with a copy of any or all books from the Written Backwards library (up to 11 books total), as well as cross-promotion and mentions within all releases to the end of 2017!

[ THE CONFESSIONS OF ST. ZACH is the beginning of the Chronicles and is an overlay. It introduces the Collapse, the Shields, the Company, and Dyed People, or DPs. Cover to be revealed soon. ]

[ THE BURDEN OF INDIGO follows a DP’s search for salvation, a man dyed for the ultimate sex crime. He believes his color is beginning to fade. He eventually meets the Rainbow Man. Cover to be revealed soon. ]

[ THE NEAR FUTURE introduces a beloved character, The Armless Conductor, and his adventures. He will return in the last book as an old man. Cover to be revealed soon. ]

[ THE FAR FUTURE tracks the waning influence of the Company, as The Family establishes dominance outside the Shields and the final Cleansing. Cover to be revealed soon. ]


Stretch Goal #5?

Perhaps you will help fund and be a part of a future Written Backwards project...


UPDATE! (07.30.15) - New perk for the writers out there! Along with the four-books (and any other unlocked books and whatnot, such as the 3 extra free books below), 5 lucky campaign-supporters in the $125 range will have the option of submitting a short story to Michael Bailey for critiquing/editing (5,000 words or less). Get this perk from now until midnight on 08.09.15! Who knows, he may want your story for his next anthology. 

UPDATE! (07.18.15) - All contributors of the 4-book or higher options of this campaign ($100-500) get 3 books from the Written Backwards library (instead of just the 1). So, if you include AT THE LAZY K, this gets you 8 book total for $100 or more, plus other options as they become available. The sponsorship options toward the end get you the most perks. $500 gets you everything within this campaign, along with a copy of any or all books from the Written Backwards library (up to 11 books total), as well as cross-promotion and mentions within all releases to the end of 2017!

story:
The Mission

Why is Fishtrap valuable? We connect creative individuals through conferences, readings, workshops, classes, performances, fellowships, and writing residencies year after year. But supporting artists isn’t enough. We seek to inspire them, to give them the tools they need and bring them together in a place that reminds us of beauty and our communal quest for meaning.

 


The Place

What is it about this place? Fishtrap is tucked in one of the most geographically rich regions in Oregon and the Western United States, Wallowa County. Incredibly diverse in terrain and ecosystems, our landscape cascades into North America’s deepest canyon, Hell’s Canyon, only to rise dramatically into 30 mountain peaks and 60 alpine lakes in the Eagle Cap Wilderness. Our flagship conference, Summer Fishtrap, takes place at the heart of this region on the shores of Wallowa Lake, a ribbon lake formed epochs ago by glaciers. Year after year writers gather here and leave sated and inspired. These geological marvels uniquely affect creativity. They remind us of meaning, and engage our most essential tool for making meaning: language.



The Innovation

Where are we going? In addition to tongues and pen and paper, Fishtrappers have begun to tell their stories in new ways. Our newest venture, Fishtrap Story Lab, marries the ancient art of storytelling with 21st century tools.  Youth and adults use technology and software to combine words, images, sounds, music, and videos to tell their stories. We have digital storytelling labs in local K–8 schools, at the head of Wallowa Lake, and just about anywhere you can carry an iPad. 


The Need

Will you help us? Will you support Fishtrap into its 30th year? Now, in 2015, our neighbors are other countries and ideas and cultures. We face new opportunities and new challenges. Fishtrap is a dedicated place of reflection, a place to share our stories and remind us that, alongside story, the land connects us.  The cost to do all this—bring award-winning instructors, maintain facilities, and provide new tools—is considerable, but more important than ever. Contributors keep this wellspring alive.

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Alisa Kathryn Stapelman. I am an Author, photographer, wife, mother, and grandmother. I wrote, published, and created my first trailer in 2014. Since then I have been working relentlessly to get the 2nd book finished. Let me state I am by no means an expert but I have some of the best people in the business helping me.

After filming, editing, and showing the trailer for the 1st book. I realized that I was going to need serious help with the 2nd trailer. I wanted to produce a book trailer unlike any other I had seen. So I went out to find a local production company that would be as passionate about my books as I am. I found that in Occulus Films (http://www.occulusfilms.com).

With Occulus Films help, I will be able to produce a book trailer unlike any you have seen before. Think a movie trailer that brings you to the edge of your seat and leaves you wanting more.

The Funds:

If we raise the needed funds, they will be used to shoot the book trailer, pay for the Book Launch Party and any monies left over will be used to work on turning the 1st book into a feature film. Once the trailer is finished, it will be premiered at the Book Launch Party on October 17, 2015.

If we go over that goal, we do have other ideas we'd like to make happen….

Stretch Goals:

If you help us meet our first goal of $5,500, we have some other special goals we’d like to go for as well and any money that is left over from the goals will be will be used as follows:

$11,000 - - Re-shoot?:

This stretch goal means we will be able to re-shoot the 1st book trailer, I Believe.

Any thing over $11,000?:

This stretch goal means we will be able to not only re-shoot the 1st book trailer, but also be able to work on getting a script written for the first book to create a feature film!

Risk and Challenges

There aren’t many risks we can think of, although things can happen. But we are hoping that everything runs smoothly with filming, the cast and crew.

The only challenges that we can think of is actually completing our goals, but we are confident that with your support, we can reach those goals and beyond.

Just a closing note, we want to thank you for viewing our project and or your helping pledge.  It means the world to us to be able to make this project happen.

Other ways you can help

We know not everyone will be able to contribute to this project. But if you want to help, that would be great! How, you ask?

Spread the word to all your friends and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Blast it on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, wherever you can!

story:
Molly and the Doggy Dentist

The Daily Rounds of a Hound 3

I am Ed Payne, the author of Molly and the Doggy Dentist --the third book in The Daily Rounds of a Hound children’s series. These books are inspired by Molly Malone, a shelter dog we adopted six years ago, who changed our lives.  

We didn't know it at the time but Molly was carrying a secret. Three weeks after she came to live with us, she blessed us with a litter of puppies. So, instead of one dog, we suddenly had 10!

The first book, The Daily Rounds of a Hound, is the story of how Molly finds her forever family.

The second book, Molly and the Bully, is a story about bullying, stereotyping and the power of love.

And now it’s time to tell another story!

Our third book, Molly and the Doggy Dentist, is a story of teeth, braces and the true source of real beauty. 


It's time to make Molly and the Doggy Dentist a reality!

The woman behind the art!

Britt Sekulić, the same artist who worked on the first two books in The Daily Rounds of a Hound series, is back again to bring this tale about Molly Malone and her pups to life.  Her work is spot on!  Britt always takes my ideas and makes them better, adding just the right playful and emotional touch.

Help us share these inspirational tales

The story of Molly and the Doggy Dentist has been brewing in my mind for the last couple of years.  The manuscript has been written and the illustrations are beautiful!  The pages are being professionally edited, formatted and prepared for the printer.

The goal is to raise $3,000 in 21 days.  All contributions will help support the book and the inspiring message of inner beauty and accepting yourself!

What Does My Support Do?

Your backing will help us: 

•  complete the illustrations

•  format for digital and paperback editions

•  cover legal and registration fees

•  pay for early PR, marketing and distribution costs


The Impact

With your contributions we will share this book with the world!  Stories like Molly and the Doggy Dentist are important for children.  In this story, Molly Malone thinks she needs a makeover.  Her unsightly teeth go this way and that.  Molly’s underbite isn’t very becoming for a young mom of nine frisky pups.  She dreams of a sparkly Hollywood smile, of being a hound about town.  Are braces the answer?  Or does beauty come from within? 

In this age of social media bullying, don’t we need more stories for our children that boost their confidence and self-image?  Every contribution will help us share that message!

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your contributions, you can support and help by sharing the Molly and the Doggy Dentist campaign.  Facebook?  Sure.  Instagram?  You bet.  Twitter?  Absolutely.  Pintrest?  Why not.  Even use email, if that works for you.  Tell everyone you know about Molly and the Doggy Dentist so this campaign can reach as many people as possible!

story:
Breve reseña

Hola a todos, soy Carlos Jiménez Duarte: autor de la novela Alumbramiento de una estrella, la cual es la primera entrega de la saga literaria El Renacer de los Astros. Quiero ser un escritor consagrado a la creación literaria y hacer una revolución en las mentes a través de mi imaginación y los contenidos expuestos en mis libros, donde se trabajan temáticas sobre la mente humano, la esperanza y el poder de la fe para unir la voluntad de toda la humanidad hacia una ruta de paz y armonía.

Pero, en el mundo actual, los escritores que mejor pueden cumplir ese sueño son aquellos que son patrocinados por las editoriales y las librerías. Para darme a conocer quiero iniciar una campaña de Bookcrossing, que es una forma de dejar que los libros viajen a través de las personas y por el mundo, de modo que mis lectores se hagan una idea del libro que ofrezco a través de Amazon. Un libro colocado deliberadamente en una mesa de un café puede ser el motivo suficiente para que un lector se tome la molestia de disfrutar al menos las primeras 5 páginas de mi libro y quedar tan cautivado que esté dispuesto a comprarlo en su versión digital, por tan solo $0,99 dólares. El Bookcrossing es una técnica muy útil para hacer llegar los contenidos de un libro, volviéndolo en una obra popular que pasa de voz a voz hasta convertirse en un éxito literario.

Observa el libro en Amazon en: http://goo.gl/g9Xbzf

¿Estás listo para ayudarme?

Conoce más sobre mi actividad literaria en universomelquiades.blogspot.com

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos producir libros de óptima calidad, de tal modo que al verlo, la persona sea vea persuadida para iniciar la lectura.

El presupuesto para este proyecto sirve para financiar al menos 120 libros, con el contenido impreso en su totalidad de mi novela. Serán 120 libros que viajarán por todo el mundo, ya que no solo los dejaría libres para que se muevan en mi propio país, sino que a través de mis contactos se podrán imprimir en otros países, acelerando así el proceso de publicidad.

La edición del libro en el programa Adobe InDesign para que este pueda ser impreso, estuvo a cargo de mi hermana que es diseñadora grafica. Ahora solo hacen falta los fondos para imprimirla.

Las recompensas se verán reflejadas en que a medida que aumenta el voz a voz, mi novela digital publicada en Amazon, logrará mayor popularidad y las personas desearán llevarla consigo en su smartphone o tablet.

En caso de no completar la meta, invertiré todos los fondos en los libros que alcancen a imprimirse.

El impacto

El libro está en todo el potencial de convertirse en un best-seller, inaugurando una nueva legión de lectores apasionados por los temas de mi obra y lo singular de sus escenarios. El impacto esta en demostrar que un autor puede triunfar por otros medios como lo puede ser un ebook bajo el patrocinio y la pubilicidad gestada con un buen sistema de bookcrossing. Es una idea revolucionaria que demuestra que si es posible

El arte y la literatura que expongo en mi obra, permite a sus lectores soñar con sus contenidos y ver más allá de los límites de la mente humana. Se trata de una novela que emocionante que cambiará la vida de muchas personas y ofrece nuevas puertas sobre la espiritualidad y la voluntad del ser humano. Una novela de aventuras totalmente épica que nos transporta a un mundo maravilloso y novedoso como lo es el planeta Ulmuden, lo que enseña de paso a las sociedades que vivir en paz y mantenerse al margen de los poderes del mal si es posible. Un libro que nos deja comprometernos con el destino de nuestro planeta y la naturaleza que posee, tal como se vivencia en este epicentro literario.

Si las cosas marchan mejor, quizá la novela pase a convertirse en un clásico que desee ser financiado por la industria cinematográfica. Todo esto representará el inicio de una larga aventura, una nueva etapa de vivir la realidad y la literatura,

Riesgos y desafíos

El único riesgo que se corren con este sistema de publicidad es que el posible lector se quede con el libro en casa y no permita que este siga circulando de mano en mano. La solución a esto está implícita en el desafío mismo del bookcrossing, el cual consiste en confiar en que los lectores apoyarán la campaña, tal como el mismo libro lo indica:

“Si este libro ha llegado a tus manos, puedes llevártelo de manera totalmente gratuita para que disfrutes de una sana lectura en el cómodo sofá de tu casa. La única condición es que una vez lo hayas leído déjalo que siga su destino, colocándolo discretamente en un buen café, en la sala de una biblioteca o entregándoselo a un amigo: muchas personas más tienen el derecho de disfrutar de esta novela y de la magia secreta que esconde.”

Observa el libro en Amazon en: http://goo.gl/g9Xbzf

Observa mis vídeos como narrador YouTuber en: https://goo.gl/DBwoVT

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Y eso es todo. Si quieres apoyarme y no tienes los fondos para hacerlo, entonces puedes hacerlo reenviando este mensaje a posibles colaboradores. Mi sueño puede cumplirse y ayudar a que muchísimas personas más cambien su óptica de ver el mundo a través de los contenidos de mi obra. Usa la opción de compartir de Indiegogo y bríndame toda tu buena energía para salir adelante con este proyecto.

Breve reseña 
Hola a todos, soy Carlos Jiménez
Duarte: autor de la novela Alumbramiento de una estrella, la cual es la primera
entrega de la saga literaria El Renacer de los Astros. Quiero ser un escritor
consagrado a la creación literaria y hacer una revolución en las mentes a
través de mi imaginación y los contenidos expuestos en mis libros, donde se
trabajan temáticas sobre la mente humano, la esperanza y el poder de la fe para
unir la voluntad de toda la humanidad hacia una ruta de paz y armonía. 
Pero, en el mundo actual, los escritores
que mejor pueden cumplir ese sueño son aquellos que son patrocinados por las
editoriales y las librerías. Para darme a conocer quiero iniciar una campaña de
Bookcrossing, que es una forma de dejar que los libros viajen a través de las
personas y por el mundo, de modo que mis lectores se hagan una idea del libro
que ofrezco a través de Amazon. Un libro colocado deliberadamente en una mesa
de un café puede ser el motivo suficiente para que un lector se tome la
molestia de disfrutar al menos las primeras 5 páginas de mi libro y quedar tan
cautivado que esté dispuesto a comprarlo en su versión digital, por tan solo
$0,99 dólares. El Bookcrossing es una técnica muy útil para hacer llegar los
contenidos de un libro, volviéndolo en una obra popular que pasa de voz a voz
hasta convertirse en un éxito literario. 
Observa el libro en Amazon en: http://goo.gl/g9Xbzf

story:
Stories aren't just what you read; they're what you tell. They take you through new doors to new places. We've put together The Crown of Secrets, a big book of stories and pictures about tigers and papayas and robots and tapioca pudding (and much more), to do just that.

  • 15 stories of the weird and wonderful, fully illustrated by eight fantastic artists
  • 9"x12" hardcover; pages printed on heavy, high-quality paper
  • Suitable for children, adults, and everybody else

We've been collaborating together on this book for well over a year and are extremely excited to bring it to you.

Art from Little Drifters (Jake Cochrane)

______________________________________________________

The books that I remember most from my childhood are the giant, illustrated poetry collections my mom would read to me; Calvin & Hobbes; stories from the Bible; DK visual dictionaries about castles and knights and other unknown things; and the weird stories about aliens and spaceships that we'd find in coloring books and on the sides of boxes of gummy fruit snacks.

They were all Big Books. Big Books are freakin' great.

In size, to be sure. You won't find many books thicker than a picture Bible. The story treasuries were always so tall that they had their own place on the top shelf. Calvin & Hobbes was always tricky because they were so long that you'd bump into them if you walked too close to the bookcase.

Just holding a book that's physically too big to hold is exciting - if you don't believe me, go try it right now.

But they were also big in ideas. History. Concept. Intelligence. Depth. I can go back to any of those and find something new, even after reading it for almost three decades. (Well, maybe not the fruit snacks.)

They inspired me - both then, as a kid, and now, as an adult. They make me want to see the beauty and wonder that I know are all around me in the world. And, yeah, you know, fruit snacks are just as important as the rest of them in all of that.

These kind of Big Books are hard to find. They're expensive - not to mention risky - to make. But that doesn't make them any less important.

So I decided to make one of my own. A Big Book, with lots of cool pictures and weird stories and interesting ideas and new worlds, something that children would enjoy just as much as adults.

And this is it.

Page from Hunting My Dress (Kristin Richland)

______________________________________________________

I'm Jeremiah. I'm a creator and an English teacher at Hebei Normal University in Shijiazhuang, the capital city of Hebei Province, China. I really like finding new ways of looking at the world, and to me, blending the linguistic and visual arts is the perfect way to do that.

About six years ago, I wrote a short story about crows turning into the night sky, and thought it would be cool to make it into an illustrated children's story. I talked to my friend Kristin, a local artist, and she thought it would be cool, too.  At the time, she was drawing a series of living dresses. We figured there had to be a story behind them.

Meanwhile, a friend teaching English in Vietnam sent me books of local children's tales featuring cute forest animals doing inexplicably horrible things to each other and frogs literally exploding in anger.

Don't worry, I do know what "literally" means.

In the course of writing stories about whatever came into my mind, a pile of surreal and not-quite-normal stories collated. The kids who read them seemed to enjoy them immensely. Making a book out of the whole thing seemed like the thing to do.

______________________________________________________

There will be approximately fifteen stories within the book's 80 pages. I won't describe them because the titles describe them pretty accurately. Also I want to create this kind of aura of mystique around the stories. Is that a thing? Pretty sure it is.

  • The Crown of Secrets (illustrated by Stephen Rigall)
  • The Tiger and the Rabbit (illustrated by Billie Austin)
  • The Last of the Giants (painting by N C Wyeth)
  • In the Land of the Dumpling Flocks (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • Hunting My Dress (illustrated by Kristin Richland)
  • Tapioca Hunt (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • Little Drifters (illustrated by Jake Cochrane)
  • What the Water Covers (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • Coyote's Constellations (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • The Robot and the Goldfish (illustrated by Xiao Ma)
  • Mr Banana's Strange Day (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • Wilderworld (illustrated by Jeremiah Christie)
  • The Sea at Night (illustrated by Karen Davie)
  • The Evening Day and Grey (illustrated by Kristin Richland)
  • Wooden Horse (photography by Natalie Slater)
A few of these may change. But, fear not, there will be 80 pages' worth of full-color stories, as well as carrots.

Story & page design from The Crown of Secrets (Stephen Rigall)
______________________________________________________

Get stuff! More than just the book. Everybody likes stuff, right? Right!
$1 - Our thanks for being involved! Receive updates with news about release events, retailers, and other assorted things that may happen
$25 ($20 limited early bird) - The book, signed by the author
$29 - The book + activity pack PDF (for parents, educators, and people who like to color), including coloring pages, games, discussion questions, and more
$42 - The book + activity pack PDF + postcards (15 5"x7" postcards, each featuring art from a different story)
$75 - The book + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt (design coming soon)
$125 - 4 books + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt
$145 - The book (one) + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt + custom canvas print (choose from any illustration in the book; canvas will be at least 12"x12")
$181 - The book (one) + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt + custom canvas print + an exclusive JUST FOR YOU mini-story handwritten by the author about (pretty much) anything you want
$250 - 10 books + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt
$2,500 - The book + activity pack PDF + postcards + t-shirt + custom canvas print + guided tour of Shijiazhuang (see all the places in Hebei Province, China, that made the book a reality - includes meals and lodging but NOT airline tickets)
Additions - If you want more than one something, we can do that! As long as you're buying the book, just add the corresponding amount of money to your contribution.
+$25 for each additional book
+$5 for the activity pack pdf
+$15 for postcards
+$35 for a t-shirt
+$75 for a canvas print
+$50 for a customized mini-story

Art & page design from The Sea At Night (Karen Davie)
______________________________________________________

This book has been my project of choice for the past two years, and I'd worked on various aspects well before that. I've written the stories, done most of the page design work, and sporadically paid my long-suffering artists out of pocket. As such, your contributions will go directly into making the physical book and making sure the artists are fairly compensated in a timely fashion.

  • $3,500 will print 300 copies of the book
  • $500 will take care of our ISBN and other legal fees
  • $700 will bring the book to your door / mailbox / other receptacle
  • $300 will cover any exciting surprises we run into
  • $500 will pay IndieGoGo and other related fees for fees
  • $1,500 (and anything above and beyond) will help the artists eat

Art from The Evening Day and Grey (Kristin Richland)

______________________________________________________

Here's what the ideal schedule looks like:

  • 3 April - funding begins
  • 18 Apiril - design work is completed
  • 23 April - printing begins
  • 3 May - funding finishes
  • 20 May - printing finishes
  • 30 May - bulk shipping begins from China
  • 1 July - books arrive in USA
  • 15 July - books begin shipping to YOU
  • 20 July - books arrive at your door / mailbox / receptacle
  • 30 July - everyone is blissfully, blissfully happy
Ideal isn't always what ends up happening, but rest assured that I'll keep you fully appraised of the situation throughout the entire journey, good or bad.

Art for The Crown of Secrets (Stephen Rigall)

______________________________________________________

Interested in assisting The Crown of Secrets get higher off the ground? Yeah you are. Here are some ways you can help:

  • Tell your local independent bookstore or library to order a copy or five
  • Share this project on social media, duh (Faceface and Twatagram and Snapgrind and WeiApp and that other cool one that I don't know about)
  • Talk about the book to people - people still talk, right? I think?
  • Buy a bunch of copies yourself, then give them to people and make them feel guilty and uncool for not knowing about it sooner
  • Rent one of those banners that they pull behind planes and have it fly over the beach or Las Vegas or wherever (and take pictures of it and send them to me)

Art for The Tiger and the Rabbit (Billie Austin)

______________________________________________________

The book is pretty much done. I'm doing the remaining design work as the final pages of art are finished, and I'm rather determined to finish the project strong. Potential risks for delay are minimal, but here they are:

  • Art and design might be delayed. There's very little remaining to be done, though, and I'll continue working days, nights, and in between the hours to make sure we stay on track.
  • The printer might take longer than anticipated. However, it's the best-reputed printer in the city, and it reliably and routinely handles projects far larger than this one.
  • Shipping might take a little while. Going from one side of the world to the other is always a little unpredictable. But the book WILL get to you.

story:
Concept

Most of you have seen, and perhaps utilized, the average birth planner. A typical planner helps you track the various stages of pregnancy; some of the more intricate planners also feature countdowns. A few might even allow you to track your doctor’s appointments, growth milestones, diet, “To Do” lists, shopping lists, etc. Others are more like journals with writing prompts and questions. Both types are typically full of helpful facts and tidbits about pregnancy, birth, and newborn care—but not a lot of detailed information or rigorous research. These really serve more as keepsakes or mementos of your pregnancy than as in-depth planners.

Additionally, you may be familiar with the massive—but amazingly helpful—wedding planners and wedding binders currently available on the market. These help brides-to-be plan every last detail of their dream day. They include a great deal of information on all the various steps of planning a wedding and allow readers to lay down exactly how they want their special day to go.

Now imagine a birth planner—a guidebook—with the detail and completeness of a wedding planner, but focused on orchestrating your own natural birth, home birth, or a more conventional birth. That's the Dream Birth Project. I want the Dream Birth Planner and Guide to inspire a woman to see her birth, first and foremost, as an amazing—even sacred—event; one that deserves all the forethought and planning of any other life-altering, socially powerful, and celebrated moment. The planner and guidebook would be specifically geared toward natural birth and home birth and would educate and empower the expecting mother (and her partner) to take the reins of her pregnancy and birth. It would provide all the information, resources, suggested readings, and tangible tools needed to plan every aspect of a “dream” natural or home birth, with all of the safety measures and backup planning in place.

 

 

My Progress

The starting point for this project is all of the research I did in planning my own birth experience...the home birth of my son. I also have the very detailed birth plans (with back-up plans) I developed, as well as the experience of pulling together the resources needed for a home birth, and the coordination of doulas, midwives and the like.

 

The table of contents—including the desired vignettes, features, tables, charts, and forms—is complete. A writing, publishing, and marketing team is in place (all part of a new venture called The Island—but more on that later) to assist with content creation, research, compiling and assembling, copyediting, publishing, and finally, printing and distribution. With my years of publishing and project management experience, my own personal home birth success, and the initial conception and vision for this project, I truly believe that I’m the right person to bring this unique and much-needed birth tool to the market. My team and I are excited to be working on the first stages of prototyping and plan to have the overall look and design nailed down soon.

 

 

About The Team

 

 

Jenefier Winchell

Mother of Three. Life Blogger, Crunchy, Plant Based, Environmentalists, Philosopher, Writer, Artist, Gentle Parent, Birth Enthusiasts, Project Manager, Publishing Manager, Textbook Acquisitions, Book Pre-production Manager

 

 

In short, I am a textbook development and acquisitions manager turned mom overnight. Almost four years ago, my partner and I began fostering his niece and nephew. It was then that I began my journey of conscious parenting. Once expecting, I took on pregnancy and birth much like I take on all new ventures in my life—with plenty of thought, research, and attention to detail. It was only natural that I would stumble upon the idea of a natural and home birth. The more research I did the more I was convinced that it was the most safest and most logical choice.

Now a little over a year after having my own amazing home birth, The Dream Birth Project is now my passion. I am on a journey to share my experience and hard-won knowledge with the birthing world! I believe the Dream Birth Planner and Guide is not only a project worth funding but also, if done correctly, a project with the potential to make waves in the birthing community and beyond.

 

 

Amber Poeschel

Mother, Wife, Activist, Doula, Advocate, Educator, Writer, Community Resource

 

 

Other than being a wife and mother to two little boys, I am a birth and postpartum doula in Northern California with a focus on loving women through their most vulnerable time through community, empowerment, and education. I have been involved in the natural birthing community since 2011 and I spend my time educating and advocating as a blogger in my free time.

 

Richard Schofield

Inventor, Engineer and Serial Entrepreneur

 

 

I'm lucky. I have a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering and a thirst for innovation. I've been an entrepreneur for thirty years and have started three successful companies. I hold five U.S. patents and have over twenty papers in scientific journals. My experiences include environmental engineering, web development, publishing, and e-commerce technology. I've been a professor, a business manager, a scientist, and a husband and father. I'm an avid outdoor enthusiast and I live to create new things.

 

The Plan

 

With this crowdfunding campaign, we hope to raise the funds that I need to buy the time necessary to continue to research, write, compile, and design the Dream Birth Planner and Guide. It’s my hope that crowdfunding will take care of the financial aspect of the project, allowing me and my team—and, if you’re willing, you—to focus on the heart of the project: the ideas.

Crowdfunding 101

 

 

With the help of a crowdfunding platform and a solid pitch, campaign video, social media buzz, and local support, anyone can connect with an audience that cares about and believes in their venture. People throughout the country (and world) can contribute to an idea in whatever amount they’re comfortable with, often contributing in the form of a preorder of the finished product. This means that creators are no longer tied to commercial sponsors or large investors. This allows for greater freedom and increases the likelihood that worthy projects will get the funds they need to come to fruition.

 

How You Can Help

 

First and foremost, you can help by generating buzz and getting the word out. If you believe our project could be helpful to someone you know, tell them! Mention it to your inner circle via email, social media feeds, blogs, and personal websites. It’s our belief that there are people out there waiting for a book like this—we just need some way to let them know what we’re up to! You can also contribute to the Dream Birth Project by preordering a copy of the book for yourself or donating a small amount in exchange for an array of other Dream Birth Project perks.

Our Budget: 45,000

 

Writing, researching, and compiling: $10,000

Market research, analysis, and promotion: $3,000

Development and publishing (typesetting and design): $8,000

Artwork and photos: $3,000

Permissions (for use of professional excerpts, citations, and photos): $5,000

Copyediting and proofreading: $3,000

Printing and distribution (as well as perk fulfillment): $5,000

Campaign costs: $5,000

Legal fees: $3,000

 

 

Perks

$39

Dream Birth Back-Stage Pass

If you can’t wait 10  to 12 months until we go to print, this perk is for you. For your gift of $39, you’ll get a back-stage pass to the “Dream Birth Incubator,” where you can watch the project as it progresses. We’ll share first-draft files with you all along the way, including everything we’ve already developed--like birth plans, useful links, e-tools and more. And we'll throw in a discount coupon for the book when it's available.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

 

$5

A Thumbs up!

Every bit counts! With this contribution you get tagged in a personalized thank you on our Facebook page.

ESTIMATED SEPTEMBER 2016

$10

Show The Love

Every bit counts! With this contribution you'll get tagged in a personalized thank you on our Facebook page. and monthly project update from the writer and Dream Birth team.

ESTIMATED SEPTEMBER 2016

$25

The Dream Birth Core Supporter

With this contribution you'll get tagged in a personalized thank you on our Facebook page as a Dream Birth Core Supporter. A monthly project update from the writer and Dream Birth team. Along with a written and mailed thank you card from the author. This is a perfect gift for family and friends that may not need a copy of the book, but want to show their support without breaking the bank.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

$25

Birth Planning e-Tools

e-tools that will help you plan every aspect of your birth. With this gift you'll get e-content sent to you weekly to utilize while birth planning or trying to conceive.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

 

$50

Dream Birth Book Pre-release

Be among the first to own a hot off the press Dream Birth Guidebook and Planner. Contributors are guaranteed an early copy of the book--we are aiming for October 2016.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2017

$65

Dream Birth Book (Signed Copy)

Be among the few to own a limited autographed edition of Dream Birth Guidebook and Planner. Contributors are guaranteed an early copy of the book--we are aiming for October 2017.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2017

$150

Dream Birth Patron

With this gift your name will be listed in the book as a "Dream Birth Patron". You'll also get a signed advanced copy of the book, access to our prototyping meetings, and access to all the birth planning e-tools.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

$300

Dream Birth Star Patron

With this gift your name will be listed in the book as a "Dream Birth Patron". You'll also get a signed advanced copy of the book, access to our prototyping meetings, and access to all the birth planning e-tools. Additionally, throughout the project we have virtual feedback sessions in which you will be invited to and encouraged to chime in on the progress of the project.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

 

$600

Dream Birth Rock Star Patron

With this gift you'll receive a personalized thank you in the special recognition section of the preface of the book. You'll also get a signed advanced copy of the book (Sept 2017), access to our prototyping meetings, and access to all the birth planning e-tools. Additionally, throughout the project we have virtual feedback sessions to which you will receive an invite to and encouraged to chime in on the progress of the project.

ESTIMATED OCTOBER 2016

 

 

How You Can Help (Again)

First and foremost, you can help by generating buzz and getting the word out. If you believe our project could be helpful to someone you know, tell them! Mention it to your inner circle via email, social media feeds, blogs, and personal websites. It’s our belief that there are people out there waiting for a book like this—we just need some way to let them know what we’re up to! You can also contribute to the Dream Birth Project by preordering a copy of the book for yourself or donating a small amount in exchange for an array of other Dream Birth Project perks. 

Your contribution is greatly appreciated!
story_txt: ConceptMost of you have seen, and perhaps utilized, the average birth planner. A typical planner helps you track the various stages of pregnancy; some of the more intricate planners also feature countdowns. A few might even allow you to track your doctor’s appointments, growth milestones, diet, “To Do” lists, shopping lists, etc. Others are more like journals with writing prompts and questions. Both types are typically full of helpful facts and tidbits about pregnancy, birth, and newborn care—but not a lot of detailed information or rigorous research. These really serve more as keepsakes or mementos of your pregnancy than as in-depth planners.Additionally, you may be familiar with the massive—but amazingly helpful—wedding planners and wedding binders currently available on the market. These help brides-to-be plan every last detail of their dream day. They include a great deal of information on all the various steps of planning a wedding and allow readers to lay down exactly how they want their special day to go.Now imagine a birth planner—a guidebook—with the detail and completeness of a wedding planner, but focused on orchestrating your own natural birth, home birth, or a more conventional birth. story:
ENGLISH WILL FOLLOW

Depuis ma tendre enfance, mon plus grand rêve était de devenir écrivain. J'ai toujours été passionnée d'écriture et de lecture. Les livres étaient pour moi, et encore davantage aujourd'hui, mes biens les plus précieux, mon trésor. Avant de devenir écrivain, je suis devenue journaliste, car je souhaitais vivre d'écriture. Mais depuis que j'ai réalisé - enfin ! - mon rêve de devenir écrivain (j'ai publié jusqu'à maintenant les deux premiers tomes de ma très appréciée série La Robe jaune, une série de contes modernes publiée chez Les Éditions Magiques, maison d'édition que j'ai fondé il y a 5 ans), mon voeux le plus cher maintenant est d'aller plus haut et plus loin avec ma compagnie en publiant le tome 3 de La Robe jaune et le tome 1 en anglais, The Yellow Dress Vol. 1, Mom in Heaven.

En publiant le tome 3, je poursuis l'aventure de La Robe jaune, qui me tient tant à coeur, et je peux ainsi continuer à insuffler la magie de la vie dans le coeur de mes lecteurs. La Robe jaune est maintenant distribuée en France, et bientôt en Belgique et en Suisse. Éventuellement, ma série se retrouvera dans toute la francophonie, c'est à dire dans tous les pays francophones du monde, grâce à un partenariat avec un distributeur français qui a, tout comme moi, des visées à l'international.

En publiant le tome 1 en anglais de La Robe jaune, c'est un marché et un succès planétaire qui attend ma série ainsi que Les Éditions Magiques. Quelle incroyable invention que l'Internet, qui permet l'ouverture et l'échange malgré la distance, et qui facilite le commerce avec des pays lointains.

En prenant de l'expansion, ma maison d'édition pourra élargir son catalogue et permettre ainsi à de nouveaux auteurs d'être publiés. Quelle joie d'aider d'autres auteurs en devenir à réaliser leur rêve, celui-là même que je caressais depuis ma tendre enfance. Mon rôle en tant qu'Éditrice et Présidente des Éditions Magiques, autant que celui d'Écrivain, est une fierté et un accomplissement qui me nourrit à chaque instant, et les échanges avec de futurs auteurs m'apportent inlassablement la même joie, jour après jour.

Parce que ma mission et celle des Éditions Magiques est d'insuffler de la magie dans le coeur des lecteurs, il était tout naturel pour Les Éditions Magiques et moi-même de nous associer à La Fondation Rêves d'enfants puisque la mission de Rêves d'enfants est d'apporter la magie du rêve dans la vie d'enfants atteints d'une maladie grave. Pour chaque livre vendu aux Éditions Magiques, un dollars (1$) sera remis à la Fondation. Pour plus d'information, visitez www.revesdenfants.ca

Le lancement du tome 3 en français se fera dans trois villes : Paris, Montréal et Québec (ma région natale). Le lancement à Paris se fera dans le cadre du Salon du livre de Paris, en mars 2016. Lors de mon premier passage au Salon de Paris, La Robe jaune et Les Éditions Magiques ont reçu un accueil très chaleureux et une réponse du public très enthousiaste et prometteuse. C'est un grand plaisir pour moi d'y retourner pour le prochain Salon.

Concernant le lancement à Montréal, je vous réserve un événement spécial avec de nombreux artistes et collaborateurs impliqués. La date sera dévoilée sous peu.

Enfin, pour ce qui est de la ville de Québec, j'aimerais bien lancer le tome 3 à l'occasion du Salon du livre de Québec, en avril 2016.

Évidemment, vous serez tous invités aux lancements et aux autres événements à venir aux Éditions Magiques.

Le tome 1 en anglais de La Robe jaune, The Yellow Dress Vol. 1, Mom in Heaven, sera également publié et lancé en 2016 à Montréal, New York et, je l'espère, à Londres. D'autres villes pourraient s'ajouter.

Voilà l'ampleur de mon projet. Vous comprenez maintenant pourquoi j'ai besoin du soutien de la communauté. Le gouvernement octroie des subventions aux maisons d'édition de taille importante, et ne semble pas trop encourager les jeunes et petites maisons comme la mienne. Cela va sûrement changer avec la nouvelle de Justin Trudeau, qui va doubler les fonds en art et culture dès 2016. Je me croise les doigts, j'aimerais bien recevoir l'aide du gouvernement pour l'expansion de ma compagnie. De toute façon, je crois davantage au fonds provenant d'investisseurs privés et, notamment, du financement participatif, tel que cette campagne actuelle avec Indiegogo.

En contribuant, vous participez à une aventure fabuleuse et vous soutenez trois bonnes causes : la littérature, les futurs auteurs à être publiés aux Éditions Magiques, et les enfants atteints d'une grave maladie (Rêves d'enfants). Vous soutenez également l'entreprenariat, et aidez Les Éditions Magiques, jeune maison d'édition, à prendre son envol autant localement qu'à l'international.

Votre contribution fait une grande différence pour moi, pour La Robe jaune, pour Les Éditions Magiques, pour la littérature et les enfants.

Contribuez maintenant, vous serez fier de votre implication au fur et à mesure que vous verrez les nouvelles défiler sur nos réseaux sociaux, sur notre site Web et dans les médias un peu partout sur la planète. Vous pourrez dire à qui veut bien l'entendre : je suis impliqué, j'ai contribué au succès de cette cause. Par l'entremise de mes projets, vous insufflerez, vous aussi, de la magie dans le coeur de milliers de personnes.

Merci de répandre la magie en utilisant les outils de partage de Indiegogo : Facebook, Twitter, Courriels... Je vous en suis très reconnaissante !

Et n'oubiez pas : cette campagne de financement n'est que le début d'une plus grande aventure qui nous attend, tous ensemble !

N'hésitez pas à offrir La Robe jaune en cadeau, pour Noël; vos parents, amis, collègues vont apprécier grandement cette lecture, au coin du feu, ou en voyage sur une plage. Aussi, nous dévoilerons sous peu notre nouveau catalogue pour 2016. Suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux et sur notre site Web.

www.facebook.com/editionsmagiques

www.facebook.com/larobejaune123

www.twitter.com/editionsmagique

www.leseditionsmagiques.com

À bientôt mes amies et amis ! Et, à ceux que je n'ai pas encore eu la chance de connaître, je dis : au plaisir de vous rencontrer !

Je vous souhaite beaucoup de magie dans votre vie et dans votre coeur !

Comme le dit si bien la princesse à La Robe jaune : Quand on ose être soi-même, les miracles s'accomplissent !

Magiquement Vôtre,

Isabelle

ENGLISH VERSION

Since I was a kid, my biggest dream was to become an author & writer. I have always been passionate by writing and reading. Books were, and are still, my very precious things, my treasure. Before I became an author, I became a journalist because I wanted to write for a living. But since I have finally realised my dream of becoming an author (I have already published my two first books in French at Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques, a publishing house I have founded 5 years ago), I really wish to go further and higher with my company by publishing in English the very first Volume of my French series, La Robe jaune, which in English is The Yellow Dress Volume 1: Mom in Heaven. By publishing the first Volume in English, the market will then become global (the planet), so I will be able to reach more readers, that means I will be able to bring magic in more hearts & lives, which is my purpose, and the purpose of Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques. By selling more books, my publishing house will get bigger. Then, I will be able to publish new authors' books, thus helping new authors to realize their own dream of becoming an author, the dream I had when I was a kid. I also wish to publish and launch the third Volume of The Yellow Dress in French, La Robe jaune tome 3.

Because my purpose & the purpose of Magical Publishing is to bring magic in the hearts & lives of people, it was naturally that we have concluded a partnership with The Children's Wish Foundation (La Fondation Rêves d'enfants); for every book soled at Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques, 1$ (one dollar) will be given to The Children's Wish Foundation. Another good reason to contribute to my project. For more information, visit www.childrenswish.ca 

More information about my projects: The first Volume of The Yellow Dress has already been translated from a professional translator from French to English. What is needed from now is to print it, promote it and launch it. I will organize great book launches in Montréal (Québec) CANADA, in the USA (New York), and in other cities in the USA, and in United Kingdom (London), in 2016. And you will be invited as a VIP guest! Plus, the book launches will be organized in very nice places with the help of many artists and major business partners. I will also launch the third Volume in French, La Robe jaune tome 3, in Montréal & in Paris in 2016.

Help me reach my goal of 10,000$. I will also ask contributions to other private investors until I reach my goal, because I really believe in what I do and where I want to go. Since the government give money only to the big publishing houses, I have never received any penny from them. With your contribution, you will participate in an important mission: to help literature, to help a young publishing house specialized in modern tales (fantasy and fairy tales), to bring magic in the lives of sick children & in the heart of other readers, plus you will bring magic in the lives of people who want to become an author, because Magical Publishing publishes new talented authors. With the publishing of my first two books in French, I have already spread magic in the lives of thousands of readers. They really appreciate the story of The Yellow Dress and the main message included in this fantasy, fairy tale: When you dare to be yourself, Miracles happen. I personally believe in that message because I have experienced it in my own life. If you wish to hear from the readers of The Yellow Dress, you can read their testimony (in French for now, in English soon). Visit the Magical Publishing' Web site www.leseditionsmagiques.com OR www.magicalpublishing.com (not yet completed, but soon !) You can also visit our Facebook' pages: www.facebook.com/larobejaune123 & www.facebook.com/editionsmagiques and www.twitter.com/editionsmagique

To launch my book in English in Canada, in the USA and in UK is a pretty nice challenge to me, but the purpose worth it. Same thing about the Volume 3 in French. Would you like to participate and be involved in this great adventure? If your answer is yes, please contribute now! If you cannot contribute but would like to be involved in the adventure, maybe you can spread the word and make some noise about it. If you are willing to do so, just use the Indiegogo share tools! That's all you need to do to contribute to 3 heartily causes: literature, sick children & new authors. Please help and spread the Magic! I will be so grateful! Thank you and I wish you a lot of Magic in your life and in your heart! Do not hesitate to offer The Yellow Dress (in French for now) as a Christmas gift !

And don't forget; this is just the beginning as I will, next year, publish new authors / new tales for children.

Isabelle
story_txt:
ENGLISH WILL FOLLOWDepuis ma tendre enfance, mon plus grand rêve était de devenir écrivain. J'ai toujours été passionnée d'écriture et de lecture. Les livres étaient pour moi, et encore davantage aujourd'hui, mes biens les plus précieux, mon trésor. Avant de devenir écrivain, je suis devenue journaliste, car je souhaitais vivre d'écriture. Mais depuis que j'ai réalisé - enfin ! - mon rêve de devenir écrivain (j'ai publié jusqu'à maintenant les deux premiers tomes de ma très appréciée série La Robe jaune, une série de contes modernes publiée chez Les Éditions Magiques, maison d'édition que j'ai fondé il y a 5 ans), mon voeux le plus cher maintenant est d'aller plus haut et plus loin avec ma compagnie en publiant le tome 3 de La Robe jaune et le tome 1 en anglais, The Yellow Dress Vol. 1, Mom in Heaven.En publiant le tome 3, je poursuis l'aventure de La Robe jaune, qui me tient tant à coeur, et je peux ainsi continuer à insuffler la magie de la vie dans le coeur de mes lecteurs. La Robe jaune est maintenant distribuée en France, et bientôt en Belgique et en Suisse. Éventuellement, ma série se retrouvera dans toute la francophonie, c'est à dire dans tous les pays francophones du monde, grâce à un partenariat avec un distributeur français qui a, tout comme moi, des visées à l'international.En publiant le tome 1 en anglais de La Robe jaune, c'est un marché et un succès planétaire qui attend ma série ainsi que Les Éditions Magiques. Quelle incroyable invention que l'Internet, qui permet l'ouverture et l'échange malgré la distance, et qui facilite le commerce avec des pays lointains.En prenant de l'expansion, ma maison d'édition pourra élargir son catalogue et permettre ainsi à de nouveaux auteurs d'être publiés. Quelle joie d'aider d'autres auteurs en devenir à réaliser leur rêve, celui-là même que je caressais depuis ma tendre enfance. Mon rôle en tant qu'Éditrice et Présidente des Éditions Magiques, autant que celui d'Écrivain, est une fierté et un accomplissement qui me nourrit à chaque instant, et les échanges avec de futurs auteurs m'apportent inlassablement la même joie, jour après jour.Parce que ma mission et celle des Éditions Magiques est d'insuffler de la magie dans le coeur des lecteurs, il était tout naturel pour Les Éditions Magiques et moi-même de nous associer à La Fondation Rêves d'enfants puisque la mission de Rêves d'enfants est d'apporter la magie du rêve dans la vie d'enfants atteints d'une maladie grave. Pour chaque livre vendu aux Éditions Magiques, un dollars (1$) sera remis à la Fondation. Pour plus d'information, visitez www.revesdenfants.caLe lancement du tome 3 en français se fera dans trois villes : Paris, Montréal et Québec (ma région natale). Le lancement à Paris se fera dans le cadre du Salon du livre de Paris, en mars 2016. Lors de mon premier passage au Salon de Paris, La Robe jaune et Les Éditions Magiques ont reçu un accueil très chaleureux et une réponse du public très enthousiaste et prometteuse. C'est un grand plaisir pour moi d'y retourner pour le prochain Salon.Concernant le lancement à Montréal, je vous réserve un événement spécial avec de nombreux artistes et collaborateurs impliqués. La date sera dévoilée sous peu.Enfin, pour ce qui est de la ville de Québec, j'aimerais bien lancer le tome 3 à l'occasion du Salon du livre de Québec, en avril 2016.Évidemment, vous serez tous invités aux lancements et aux autres événements à venir aux Éditions Magiques.Le tome 1 en anglais de La Robe jaune, The Yellow Dress Vol. 1, Mom in Heaven, sera également publié et lancé en 2016 à Montréal, New York et, je l'espère, à Londres. D'autres villes pourraient s'ajouter.Voilà l'ampleur de mon projet. Vous comprenez maintenant pourquoi j'ai besoin du soutien de la communauté. Le gouvernement octroie des subventions aux maisons d'édition de taille importante, et ne semble pas trop encourager les jeunes et petites maisons comme la mienne. Cela va sûrement changer avec la nouvelle de Justin Trudeau, qui va doubler les fonds en art et culture dès 2016. Je me croise les doigts, j'aimerais bien recevoir l'aide du gouvernement pour l'expansion de ma compagnie. De toute façon, je crois davantage au fonds provenant d'investisseurs privés et, notamment, du financement participatif, tel que cette campagne actuelle avec Indiegogo.En contribuant, vous participez à une aventure fabuleuse et vous soutenez trois bonnes causes : la littérature, les futurs auteurs à être publiés aux Éditions Magiques, et les enfants atteints d'une grave maladie (Rêves d'enfants). Vous soutenez également l'entreprenariat, et aidez Les Éditions Magiques, jeune maison d'édition, à prendre son envol autant localement qu'à l'international.Votre contribution fait une grande différence pour moi, pour La Robe jaune, pour Les Éditions Magiques, pour la littérature et les enfants.Contribuez maintenant, vous serez fier de votre implication au fur et à mesure que vous verrez les nouvelles défiler sur nos réseaux sociaux, sur notre site Web et dans les médias un peu partout sur la planète. Vous pourrez dire à qui veut bien l'entendre : je suis impliqué, j'ai contribué au succès de cette cause. Par l'entremise de mes projets, vous insufflerez, vous aussi, de la magie dans le coeur de milliers de personnes.Merci de répandre la magie en utilisant les outils de partage de Indiegogo : Facebook, Twitter, Courriels... Je vous en suis très reconnaissante !Et n'oubiez pas : cette campagne de financement n'est que le début d'une plus grande aventure qui nous attend, tous ensemble !N'hésitez pas à offrir La Robe jaune en cadeau, pour Noël; vos parents, amis, collègues vont apprécier grandement cette lecture, au coin du feu, ou en voyage sur une plage. Aussi, nous dévoilerons sous peu notre nouveau catalogue pour 2016. Suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux et sur notre site Web.www.facebook.com/editionsmagiqueswww.facebook.com/larobejaune123www.twitter.com/editionsmagiquewww.leseditionsmagiques.comÀ bientôt mes amies et amis ! Et, à ceux que je n'ai pas encore eu la chance de connaître, je dis : au plaisir de vous rencontrer !Je vous souhaite beaucoup de magie dans votre vie et dans votre coeur !Comme le dit si bien la princesse à La Robe jaune : Quand on ose être soi-même, les miracles s'accomplissent !Magiquement Vôtre,IsabelleENGLISH VERSIONSince I was a
kid, my biggest dream was to become an author & writer. I have always been passionate
by writing and reading. Books were, and are still, my very precious things, my
treasure. Before I became an author, I became a journalist because I wanted to
write for a living. But since I have
finally realised my dream of becoming an author (I have already published my
two first books in French at Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques, a
publishing house I have founded 5 years ago), I really wish to go further and
higher with my company by publishing in English the very first Volume of my
French series, La Robe jaune, which in English is The Yellow Dress Volume 1:
Mom in Heaven. By publishing the first Volume in English, the market will then
become global (the planet), so I will be able to reach more readers, that means
I will be able to bring magic in more hearts & lives, which is my purpose,
and the purpose of Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques. By selling more
books, my publishing house will get bigger. Then, I will be able to publish new
authors' books, thus helping new authors to realize their own dream of becoming
an author, the dream I had when I was a kid. I also wish to publish and launch
the third Volume of The Yellow Dress in French, La Robe jaune tome 3.
Because my
purpose & the purpose of Magical Publishing is to bring magic in the hearts
& lives of people, it was naturally that we have concluded a partnership
with The Children's Wish Foundation (La Fondation Rêves d'enfants); for every
book soled at Magical Publishing / Les Éditions Magiques, 1$ (one dollar) will
be given to The Children's Wish Foundation. Another good reason to contribute
to my project. For more information, visit www.childrenswish.ca 

More
information about my projects: The first Volume of The Yellow Dress has already been translated
from a professional translator from French to English. What is needed from now
is to print it, promote it and launch it. I will organize great book launches
in Montréal (Québec) CANADA, in the USA (New York), and in other cities in the
USA, and in United Kingdom (London), in 2016. And you will be invited as a VIP guest!
Plus, the book launches will be organized in very nice places with the help of
many artists and major business partners. I will also launch the third Volume
in French, La Robe jaune tome 3, in Montréal & in Paris in 2016.
Help me reach my goal of 10,000$. I will also ask contributions to other private investors until I reach my goal, because I really
believe in what I do and where I want to go. Since the government give money
only to the big publishing houses, I have never received any penny from them.
With your contribution, you will participate in an important mission: to help literature,
to help a young publishing house specialized in modern tales (fantasy and fairy
tales), to bring magic in the lives of sick children & in the heart of
other readers, plus you will bring magic in the lives of people who want to
become an author, because Magical Publishing publishes new talented authors. With the publishing of my first two books in French, I
have already spread magic in the lives of thousands of readers. They
really appreciate the story of The Yellow Dress and the main
message included in this fantasy, fairy tale: When you dare to be
yourself, Miracles happen. I personally believe in that message because I
have experienced it in my own life. If you wish to hear from the readers
of The Yellow Dress, you can read their testimony (in French for now, in English soon). Visit the Magical Publishing' Web site www.leseditionsmagiques.com OR www.magicalpublishing.com (not yet completed, but soon !) You can also visit our Facebook' pages: www.facebook.com/larobejaune123 & www.facebook.com/editionsmagiques and www.twitter.com/editionsmagique
To launch my
book in English in Canada, in the USA and in UK is a pretty nice challenge to
me, but the purpose worth it. Same thing about the Volume 3 in French. Would you like to participate and be involved in
this great adventure? If your answer is yes, please contribute now! If you cannot
contribute but would like to be involved in the adventure, maybe you can spread
the word and make some noise about it. If you are willing to do so, just use
the Indiegogo share tools! That's all you need to do to contribute to 3
heartily causes: literature, sick children & new authors. Please help and
spread the Magic! I will be so grateful! Thank you and I wish you a lot of
Magic in your life and in your heart! Do not hesitate to offer The Yellow Dress (in French for now) as a Christmas gift !And don't forget; this is just the beginning as I will, next year, publish new authors / new tales for children.

Isabelle

story:
What is our book about?

"Modern Alchemy for Emotional Freedom," is a revolutionary book, whereby you are taught how to use your innate tools to release emotional and physical pain, (on a conscious and subconscious level), in a short time span - sometimes even within minutes.      

Not only does it contain our personal stories, - like how Yurai was able to ditch cocaine and alcohol, and I was able to release trauma surrounding having been raped, as well as years of heartache around food - we're giving you a step by step guide as to how you can resolve your own issues. 

BUT, that's just the first half of the book. We would love to include your own personal stories of how tapping has changed your life in the second half of the book. 

In saying that, we're very much excited about writing this book with you and seeing your change in the process. 

So how does Modern Alchemy work?

By way of "tapping," (repeatedly pressing), on acupressure/meridian points, with your fingers, based on ancient Chinese Medicine, (by no means a trend or momentary fad), working to free energy that's stuck within you, creating balance and free flow again. 

Think of tapping like this: 

You regularly take a shower or bath to clean your exterior body, so when you tap, in essence, you're doing the same thing - cleaning - except you're cleaning the interior of your body, your own energy system, of whatever issue you're giving focus to. 

Here's a video for you to see the tapping points. (You'll also find a link from here on how to tap away fear :) ). 


Who's it for and When can you do it?

Any and everyone, anytime, anyplace. 

We've experienced the magic of tapping not only on ourselves, but also on animals and even plants. It's possible to tap on behalf of someone, like a baby for example, who's only self-expression is crying.

Truly, one of the most beautiful things about tapping is that it's so easy (unbelievably!), and once you start, you can't help but share it, hence the reason we're writing this book, and one of the things we encourage you to do too- to "pay it forward." 

Why tap?

You want to feel better from the inside out. 

You wish to break old habitual & irritating patterns of behaviour. 

You wish to be pain free. 

Ultimately, you wish to create the life you've been dreaming of, to become your own Modern Alchemist, taking back your own power in the tips of your very fingers :) 

How are your funds being used? 

Other than covering a days work for our wonderful cameraman, truth be told, since we decided to follow our hearts, and ditch everything else we were doing, we've maxed out our credit cards, and just about everyone we can ask for financial support. 

So, we turn to you, and ask for your generosity to carry us, to help us with the debts we've accumulated before and during the campaign, so that we can ensure that our book does get released as soon as as possible, once the campaign ends, for you to start experiencing the magic we have. 

Please note that in the event that we do not reach our goal, for each of you who contributed, you will still receive your chosen perk, along with the e-book :)

-- 

Modern Alchemy for Emotional Freedom really does give you the tools to effect immediate change within yourself, should you be willing- and there's no bending the truth by saying that. Please don't take our word for it though, please try it for yourself :) 

Thanks ever so much for your energy, your support and your precious time. 

Peace & love, 

Yurai & Munjeet

story:
S L A T E D

Imagine the comedic stylings of the television show Psych, mixed with the horror and cringeworthy moments from Mr. Mercedes. We follow Detective Raymond Slate, and his partner Audrey "AJ" Ling, as they track down a serial killer, hell-bent on destroying Slate's lustrious career. Comedy, levity and heartache -- who could ask for anything more?


The Purpose

Plain and simple, this is to physically put a book into your hands, that I know you'll enjoy. The opportunity lies in the more contributions I receive, the better the book becomes for everyone. How? Because the more reservations I receive for Slated, the lower the cost will be for printing on a grand scale.

If I can hit at least 200 contributions, this book will be very posh.

500 contributors? And suddenly we're looking at better materials, designs, truly professional editing and a possibility of some hardcover copies.

Over 600?! Well...that's three-state book tour worthy. Aw, yeah.

You can check out some of my writing on my blog, as well as my Amazon store for other published works. Also, if you're an avid racing fan, check out my writings there as well.

I've aimed for around 40,000 words, which makes this compendium long enough for me to write, and for you to read. My deadline for all editing and cover design work is October 15th, which gives plenty of time for the book to be whisked away and arrive at your front door by November.

I also want to make this as fun as possible for all involved. A contribution of $3 will get you updates, via email, from myself as I clue you in on progress, finalized designs and other avenues as we venture into this journey.

What if I don't have the cash, but I still dig your idea?

No worries! Good news is it doesn't cost you a dime to share this project on your social media accounts. So tweet, post, link, and email, because every share has the potential to help me reach my goal. Use #Slated when sharing please!

Thanks a million,


- Christopher
