story:
1. Short Summary

Margo Candelario was born in San Bernardino, California. She moved to New York at the age of seventeen, where her interest in the arts and culture flourished. She attended Germaine School of Photography in 1984 studying commercial manipulation of lights, props, cable releases and the dark room, spending hours in the dark studying every shade of gray. She welcomed the challenge of discovering where her talents were the strongest, behind the lens in plain sight or in the dark.

Seven years later she married Phil Candelario, had their first daughter and relocated to the State of Georgia, seeking a slower pace and healthier environment. Unable to find employment outside of the home, Margo began to focus on her God given talent to create art, learning the market and finding a niche. As her name began to generate a buzz in the art community, her husband suffered a massive heart attack at the age of thirty four, leaving three children with questions and fear of death and separation. Uncomfortable leaving three small children in the care of strangers, Ms. Candelario resurrected her talent for storytelling and writing to generate an income while also helping others who have suffered a loss. “Take Me To The Water” was her first book of poems about love and the benefits of waiting for the natural sequence of relationship development.

Margo was invited to lecture and perform her poetry at several Universities in the states of Georgia, South Carolina, and New York, earning her the 1999 author of the year poetry category nomination. In 2008 six poems were  published in an Anthology called “The New Poetry Showcase Myspace” by Copeland Books in the U.K and in 2009 her children’s book “Looking to the Clouds for Daddy” illustrated by Jerry Craft was released and reviewed by notables. Margo Candelario is an accomplished, award winning visual artist with works exhibited from Hawaii to the eastern seaboard. She currently resides in Georgia with her three daughters and Mother who share in a family business called Young Female Farmers, specializing in Naturally Grown produce and baked goods.

http://youngfemalefarmers.com

Hello I am John Gholson, and I am working together with Margo, a seasoned writer for this unique children's book.  I have a gift which lets me express my ideas, visions, and surroundings, in a visually unique way. My ultimate dream is to find balance in my life, work, and adventures outside of the studio. My future plans will focus on this vision, along with the people who would like to see my dream become a reality.



I have been surrounded by art my entire life. My mother is an artist, so I was encouraged to draw and paint at a very young age. I submitted my first painting for exhibit at age 6; since then, I have been acclaimed as a talented young artist. My style is to incorporate a broad array of bright colors into my artwork; saying more with less. Continue reading about my artist – illustrator bio here

http://john-gholson.artistwebsites.com/index.html?tab=about

View my artwork here

http://www.JohnGholson.com

For this project, I am using a traditional to digital work flow. It is a superior technique to get the best of both worlds; and is cutting edge, using the latest most up to date technologies combined with the great masters layering methods.

I also use light plus shadows, with a middle ground foreground, and background for each illustration. Making sure that every page, is a work of art by itself.

I bring a great use of perspective to the illustrations; that will help create the environment for the scenes in the story. 



This campaign is important to both Margo and I for several reasons

it addresses these current relevant topics.

"healthy eating"

"conflict resolution"

"negotiation skills"

"persuasion methods"

"healthy sense of adventure and exploration"

By endorsing this project you are supporting all of the ideologies presented above, and you are helping two talented passionate individuals follow their dreams by pursuing their craft. If you cannot donate to the project financially, but still want to support what we are doing thats okay.  Please spread the word to your friends and family, to let them know that you are as excited as we are, and want to spread the positive story campaign to those who need and would like to hear it! Thank you for taking your time thus far to read this information.

    1. What We Need & What You Get


To see this project to completion Margo and I need to raise 10,000 dollars to finish the book and contribute to distribution, marketing, and creation cost.

For the digital books we are going to be utilizing the amazon kindle platform, which Margo's other book, "Looking to the Clouds for Daddy", is now available on.

We are focusing most of our efforts on the ebook Kindle platform.  At certain donation levels we will be offering full black and white coloring books of the story with the characters. Keep in mind that at the 3rd donation levels you can take home an original piece of artwork from the book.

Each illustration takes approximately 1 – 2 days to complete, scan digitize and convert the line drawing to a colored page. The book is going to have many illustrations, full color, high quality.

Margo needs time, a very important resource for all writers and artist, to fine tune and add the finishing touches to the story. For many people reading this, you may have never created a work of art or poetry, you may see it as a magical process. It is magical, but it takes time, money, and resources to create. We both have years of training and real world success in our chosen fields. You are working with professionals.


There are several perks that are included for donating to this project.

In fact there are 3 categories of support. And there are 9 donation levels.

remember even if you cannot contribute financially you can share this and help us spread the word.  Simply tell your friends to load this page, or go to:

http://www.book.gqbum.com   

Here are the 9 donation levels. Descriptions of the Perks are included on the right hand side of the page. Thank you for any support you can contribute to this project.


25$

30$

50$


100$

150$

250$


300$

500$

1000$

have been surrounded by art my entire life. My mother is an artist,
so I was encouraged to draw and paint at a very young age. I
submitted my first painting for exhibit at age 6; since then, I have
been acclaimed as a talented young artist. My style is to incorporate
a broad array of bright colors into my artwork; saying more with
less.  Continue reading about my artist – illustrator bio here 


http://john-gholson.artistwebsites.com/index.html?tab=about


View
my artwork here

http://www.JohnGholson.com


For
this project, I am using a  traditional to digital work flow.  It is
a superior technique to get the best of both worlds; and is cutting
edge, using the latest most up to date technologies combined with the
great masters layering methods.


I
also use light plus shadows, with a middle ground foreground, and
background for each illustration.  Making sure that every page, is a
work of art by itself. 


I
bring a great use of perspective to the illustrations; that will help
create the environment for the scenes in the story. 
This
campaign is important to both Margo and I for several reasons

it
addresses these current relevant topics.


"healthy
eating"

"conflict
resolution"

"negotiation
skills"

"persuasion
methods"

"healthy
sense of adventure and exploration"


By
endorsing this project you are supporting all of the ideologies
presented above, and you are helping two talented passionate
individuals follow their dreams by pursuing their craft.  If you
cannot donate to the project financially, but still want to support
what we are doing thats okay.  Please spread the word to your friends and family, to let them know that you are as excited as we are, and want to spread
the positive story campaign to those who need and would like to hear
it!  Thank you for taking your time thus far to read this
information.  






			What
			We Need & What You Get






To
see this project to completion Margo and I need to raise 10,000
dollars to finish  the book and contribute to distribution, marketing, and creation cost.  


For
the digital books we are going to be utilizing the amazon kindle
platform, which Margo's other book, "Looking to the Clouds for Daddy",
is now available on.
We are focusing most of our efforts on the ebook Kindle platform.  At certain donation levels we will be
offering full black and white coloring books of the story with the
characters.  Keep in mind that at the 3rd
donation levels you can take home an original piece of artwork from
the book.  


Each
illustration takes approximately 1 – 2 days to complete, scan
digitize and convert the line drawing to a colored page.  The book is
going to have many illustrations, full color, high quality.  


Margo
needs time, a very important resource for all writers and artist, to
fine tune and add the finishing touches to the story.  For many
people reading this, you may have never created a work of art or
poetry, you may see it as a magical process.  It is magical, but it takes
time, money, and resources to create.  We both have years of  training
and real world success in our chosen fields.  You are working with
professionals.  




There
are several perks that are included for donating to this project. 


In
fact there are 3 categories of support.  And there are 9 donation
levels.  


remember
even if you cannot contribute financially you can share this and help
us spread the word.  Simply tell your friends to load this page, or go to:http://www.book.gqbum.com   
Here
are the 9 donation levels.  Descriptions of the Perks are included on
the right  hand side of the page.  Thank you for any support you can
contribute to this project.  




25$

30$

50$



100$

150$

250$



300$

500$

1000$

story:
Hi! I'm Valerie Williams-Sanchez, author of the  the "Cocoa Kids Collection" of children's books. 

First, it was Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain©. Now, Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod© is revving up, ready to take pole position. But, we need your help!

Here's the story: Eddie's a city kid whose obsession with cars and race car driving get in the way of his studies, particularly his math studies. But, when a substitute teacher, who affectionately goes by the moniker "Mr. Math," arrives with a similar love of hot cocoa and sports cars, young Eddie decides to give math one last try. In the end, Eddie learns the reward of his hard work, and that all teachers really aren't so bad. 

Featuring  the newest in the Cocoa Kids Collection© cast of multicultural characters, including "Auntie" who we first met in Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain©, and her son, "Eddie,"  this second work of fiction pulls readers deeper into the Cocoa Kids' sweet, little, chocolate-sprinkled world. 

With illustrations from returning artist Brooklyn Russell, the new title includes a nod to current and historic Black race car drivers, like F1 racing phenom Lewis Hamilton (#44), and Wendell Scott, the first Black race car driver inducted into the NASCAR Hall of Fame. All of whom are winners and among Eddie's real life inspirations to never give up. 

Echoing the sentiment to "never give up," this book project is also again reaching out to readers,  like you, in its effort to grow funding support. Last time, we achieved a mere 11% of our financial goal. Won't you contribute on this lap, to ensure we cross the finish line of the project that strives to provide books featuring publishing's most underrepresented audience -- children of color? 

You'll be happy you did! 

Thank you,

Valerie ~ 


#AllKidsNeedBooks! -- about all kinds of kids! @ValorenaOnline

Riddle answer: "race car" is rac ecar, or "race car," spelled backwards.

Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod © 2015. All Rights Reserved. Valerie Williams-Sanchez, Valorena Online, L.L.C., P.O. Box 180, Palisades, NY  10964.


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for $5,000 for publishing costs and first run printing expense, including design, layout printing, marketing and promotion.  

Here's what you'll get for your contribution:

$20 -- Eddie's Cocoa Crew Thank U 

You're part of Eddie's cocoa (pit) crew, now!  And your contribution will be acknowledged with gratitude in all marketing, including: Valerie's Vignettes, the company blog and newsletter; all social media; in traditional promotional marketing, and sponsor communications.

$40 -- Signed, Sealed, Delivered...It's Yours!

Giving at this level will get you a personalized and signed copy of the new book as well as inclusion in all project marketing sponsors listings, including:Valerie's Vignettes, the company blog and newsletter; all social media; in traditional promotional marketing, and sponsor communications.

$80 -- Pole Position Paring

Start your engines! -- and your Cocoa Kids Collection© with this perk that bring the Cocoa Kids Collection to you. You'll get signed versions of the two titles: Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain, and Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod, as well as: Valerie's Vignettes, the company blog and newsletter; all social media; in traditional promotional marketing, and sponsor communications.

$150 -- Cocoa Kids Collection Tool Box

Signed copies of Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain and Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod; the Emotion Commotion workbook and art pack, Hot Cocoa Kids Collection stickers or pin, as well as  acknowledgment, with gratitude, in all marketing, including: Valerie's Vignettes, the company blog and newsletter; all social media; in traditional promotional marketing, and sponsor communications.

$500 -- The Winner's Circle

Your name on the dedication page will usher you into the winners' circle where a special thank you message will be part of each and every copy of the new title, Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod.  This perk also includes a copy of Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain, Emotion Commotion workbook and art pack, Cocoa Kids Collection sticker or button, and aacknowledgment, with gratitude, in all marketing, including: Valerie's Vignettes, the company blog and newsletter; all social media; in traditional promotional marketing, and sponsor communications.


The Impact

Why Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod Matters

Today, roughly 37% of the U.S. population are people of color. However, according to data published by Lee & Lowe Books, over the past 18 years, less than 10% of children's books published feature multicultural content. Yes, that's correct, less than 10% of the books are written with children of color in mind.

The Cocoa Kids Collection© looks to impact that statistic!

The story features:

~ Out-loud reading-friendly text 

~ Colorful, hand-drawn artwork

~ Pro-social messaging that encourages education

~ Features a Multi-cultural main character and his family

These features benefit children of every hue.

 And, this project needs your help!


Risks & Challenges

Without this funding, this project may NOT be completed.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the link and help spread the word.

story:
A justice system run amok ...

Edge of 17 is a gripping tale of a young man who goes from high school track star to accused sex offender to convicted felon, simply for doing what high school students do every day.

Nothing is as it seems in this fictionalized story about the true experiences of a young man and his family. In real life, the young man known in the book as “Taylor” is one of many young men still trapped in our prison system. In the meantime, his story must be told.

A mandatory sentence is a court decision where judicial discretion is limited by law. Typically, people convicted of certain crimes must be punished with at least a minimum number of years in prison.

What would you do if you learned your son was a going to be a victim of what many call a broken system?

The Colorado prison system faces a crisis generated by one law enacted in 1998 (read about the law and its consequences here.)

Taylor’s family faces a crisis of their own as they live through the horror of a rape charge against him … the broken justice system … the unwitting betrayal caused by the wrong words uttered to the wrong person.


Why this book now?  

Because my wife and I were disgusted when we visited our son and the number of similar young men facing the same fate or worse. I am also the author of the forthcoming novel, Edge of 17. This book is about love and redemption, sex crimes and the nation’s broken justice system.

I know about the Colorado justice system – I learned it the hard way.

I want this story to serve as a beacon for other families facing the uncertainties of the legal system. I want mothers and siblings to know what to say when someone in law enforcement asks them a question that can lead their loved one down a path to a life sentence.

Even though my son was only doing what so many other kids his age do every day in this country, he got caught up in the legal system because of seemingly innocent things said by friends and family. The people involved were thinking they were assisting in getting my son a well-deserved slap on the wrist and they ended up getting him deep into a system that doesn’t serve young people who make mistakes. What a nightmare.

And to compound the whole awful mess even more, my son opted for a plea bargain instead of taking a chance on having an indeterminate life sentence thrown at him. Too many people around the country take that road instead of fighting for their rights … because of fear, because of the expense, because of bad advice.

You’ll have to read the book to get the whole picture. In the meantime, look at the news and note the number of politicians and activists who are sounding the alarm about mass incarcerations and a whole generation of people with ruined lives due to the criminal way the system works.

One of the most watched TED Talks (with over 2.3 million views) is Bryan Stephenson talking about the broken criminal justice system. It's a BIG problem.

Thank you for your interest in this fictionalized account of a justice system run amok. And thank you for helping me bring my book, Edge of 17, to life. 

What the funding is for:

  • Manuscript preparation 
  • Copy editing and proofreading
  • Interior design
  • Book cover design
  • Preparation and formatting for print book version
  • E-book conversion
  • Indiegogo and Paypal percentage
  • Initial order of print books
  • Marketing campaign
  • Creation of book website

story: I am raising funds for a possible publication of a book or/and a documentary. I was in exile with my family in Denmark (1978), from South Africa's apartheid system. I call myself an afro-asian-danishstani as our ancestors in South Africa date back to the 1860's indentured labourers from India who were brought to work in the sugarcane plantations. I would like to raise money to explore documenting these trajectories through food, recipe's and the relationships it forged which reflects our migration. As years have gone by here in South Africa (returned in 1992), I have often made dishes that remind me of our friends and family, following my parent’s example, as they collected recipes from home (South Africa) before going into exile in Denmark. We all still use that little faded and stained handwritten brown book, which my mother began before 1978…which continued to be filled with recipes from the people we met over the years in Denmark and Tanzania. When I think back upon our childhood in Denmark, I remember Keld’s comforting soups, our Chilean friends homemade mayonnaise (aioli), Maria’s lavish Mediterranean/Armenian spreads, Linda’s Frikadeller, Aunty Joyce’s Eable kage, just to mention a few. I guess cooking these dishes now, are a way to stay connected and to remember people and places by…also it has become a way to bring the past and my childhood into the present, through recreating the taste and smells we remember from the smells met in the kitchens and gardens, marking everyday rituals, a shared meal, a special event, most of all the smells, taste and textures that has come to define who we are. Our kitchen, food and eating culture is saturated by the relationships we forged with people and even to the extent of our (my families and my own) political solidarity. In many ways our menu can be read as a map of belonging, love, friendship and solidarity with people and places. To celebrate these relationships and to reflect the poetics of politics and love through food, I would like to create a collaboration in which I will try collect stories and food recipes, a meal, an anecdote that we have shared or that have come to influence our lives or the lives of people whose path met ours. I imagine that the end product will be presented in the form of a book, a possible film documentary that will reflect how we remember and celebrate these connections and how we are remembered and celebrated…reciprocated in recipes.

story:
Welcome to ‘Publish Plus’!

PLUS is a magazine, curated by students at the University of Edinburgh,  dedicated to long-form, opinion, and photo journalism. 

Some of our team, illustrated by the immensely talented Sheela G

What is PLUS?

Prospective contributors are encouraged to submit long-form articles, columns, creative nonfiction and photo essays. Submissions to PLUS are not limited to students at the University of Edinburgh; the first issue has already welcomed writers and photographers from universities across the UK and Europe, with more intro-national and international submissions anticipated as the magazine grows. 


PLUS encourages first-person reportage in all of its submissions, aiming to produce content that is original, challenging, engaging and ambitious. We try not, as some student journalism does, to indulge our contributors: everything is produced and edited with our readers' interest at heart. 


How does PLUS work?


PLUS is published bi-semesterly, with a total of four issues per academic year, and is distributed across Edinburgh in University and public venues. 

PLUS provides a valuable print outlet for emerging writers, illustrators, designers and photographers. Running in parallel to an online presence, PLUS’s physical form has been designed and printed with the aim of offering a robust, professional, and striking portfolio for the very best of student creatives. We at PLUS encourage our readers to cut and rip from the magazine's bindings to frame, cherish and share its pages. We urge readers to pass PLUS on, copy to copy, or simply leave it open on a coffee table for others to joyfully discover.  


Illustration by Emeline Beroud

 What can I find in PLUS?

In ISSUE ONE, Simon Brinkmann Jønler argues against a sartorial tradition in black and Madeleine Kelly explores the threat Alexei Navalny poses to Putin in an uncertain Russia...



Barney Eliot writes in from a boarding house in deepest, darkest Lyon, and Michael Vince Kim documents the Koryo-Saram of Kazakhstan in luscious medium format.


Illustration by Emeline Beroud  



...and much, much (65 pages worth) more. 

Where is the money going?

Every contributor to the magazine, from editor to illustrator, produces their copy on their own resources. Whilst we put everything we can into getting PLUS up and running, we do need some help with our remaining expenditure. 

Thanks to the tireless efforts of the staff at the University of Edinburgh’s Printing Services department, we have a fantastic deal on the cost of manufacture and distribution. Each issue of PLUS costs £650.00 to produce. 

For Issue 1, we've already raised £250.00

With your help, we can raise the remaining funds we need to put PLUS in reader's hands.

To show our appreciation for your contribution, and to ensure that you get to read PLUS wherever in the world you may be, a £10 donation will see a copy posted directly to you, along with a handwritten thank-you note expressing our undying gratitude! Just provide us with your name and address when making a donation, and we'll ensure that PLUS is with you the second it's off the press. 


What are the risks and challenges? 

The first issue of the magazine is already complete. In order to get the best volume/printing cost ratio, our target goal is the aforementioned £650.00. 

This campaign is running on flexible funding, which means that even if we don't hit our goal amount, we still receive whatever has been donated after 14 days. 

We can, and will, print to whatever volume our budget allows, so a copy is guaranteed for you, dear backer, even in the event that we don't raise our target amount. 


Share, share, share!

Finally, we ask that you share this campaign with anyone and everyone who might be interested! Whether by Facebook, email, telephone or skywriting - any and all interest is welcome!

All that's left is for us to thank you very much for time and interest in 'Publish PLUS', and we look forward to sending you your very own copy!

Finally, we ask that you share this campaign with anyone and everyone who might be interested! Whether by Facebook, email, telephone or skywriting - any and all interest is welcome!
All that's left is for us to thank you very much for time and interest in 'Publish PLUS', and we look forward to sending you your very own copy!

story:
**Please do not post my real name in the comments.  Thanks.  lol

About the Novel

NINETEEN-YEAR-OLD Maestri Craft was perfectly content living in a small town in Aridete.  A place he lived for nearly eight years now.  His life was safe, simple and ordinary; none of which was ever enough for his best friend, Jace.  Jace was turning two decades and in the eyes of munfolk, that meant he would become a man.  Only Jace wasn’t of mun and that would put him in danger.  Possibly even end his life.  Knowing he would be forced to leave town, Mae was unwilling to let him go alone.  He had a secret, and it was time he did something about it.

Their journey will send them on a unique quest.  From being chased by a hag, to flying on winged horses and even a confrontation with a vampire, they come across friends and foes of all creatures.  The only problem is, nothing is black and white and not everyone is as friendly as they seem.  Haunted by the curse that follows his bloodline, it soon becomes apparent to Mae that no matter what you do or how far you run, your past will always catch up to you.

The tale of the cursed brothers; one with the strength to kill and the other, the courage to resist.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $2,500 to help out with line editing, copy editing, layout and design of a paperback, hardcover and e-book format (approx. $1,800), creation of each format, proof copies, ISBNs ($300), IndieGoGo and other various fees, plus covering all perks listed on the side!  I also wanted to set up an author website which can also be costly (monthly/yearly fees).  If I don't meet my goal, I will figure something out.  Whether I reach it or not, my main concerns will be getting out the perks offered. 
Note: They might be a bit delayed from what is listed because I'll have to come up with the difference myself somehow but it will be my top priority.  :)

The perks with my signature are the most pricey because I don't want to write on my book... hahaha.  But I certainly will for those donations.

The Last Chronomancer is the start of a series, so should I reach my goal and exceed it, any further funding will help me with costs of future novels.

(available in S-3XL)

The Impact

I have been a fan of stories, primarily fantasy, for a long time now.  Taken out of your existing world and put into another to explore has always been a very magical experience for me.  Only the problem is, nearly everyone is always white.  Many of the characters in my novel are of different ethnicities with most of them being biracial.  Though for me, diversity doesn't end there.  When you write a book, it's important to create people.  People we can meet on the street in our every day lives.  People who are real.  Truth is, people are diverse, whether it's shown through their outer appearance or not.  There's diversity of all sorts, race, gender identity, romantic and sexual orientations.

I want to self publish because I want to put out the book I wrote.  I've done extensive research for traditional publication for years and I quickly came to the conclusion that I don't want someone else changing my characters or the themes placed in my novel based on what they think will sell and what won't.  I'm a bit of a control freak, and basically putting my child in someone else's hands and asking them to care for it freaks me out.  I think I have an interesting story to tell with characters you'll fall in love with and I'd like to share it. 

Any contribution would be amazing (even just supporting the cause) and will bring me one step closer to a proper publication.

I only have about 20 days because I started this late (planning to release the book mid/end of November or EARLY December at the very latest) but hopefully I'll be able to raise something during that time.  :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help! 

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!  (On the left)  Posting them and emailing them out wherever you can.
  • Spreading the word, whether it's through social media or other networks.
  • Honestly, just support is lovely so if you've made it this far, thank you so much!

story:
I plan to visit all 251 countries of the world. And hitchhiking only. No buses, no trains, no planes. Only hitchhiking by autos and ships. And want to write How-To Guide for Hitchhiking Anywhere on the Planet.

Throughout this journey, I intend to keep notes, get to know local residents, and document through photography.

These will all be formatted into blogs where internet access is available,

then posted online to share with whomever desires to read them. This is not a profit-making venture.

I only intend to help others cope with their illness by sharing my own experiences and answering any questions they may have.

However, I think this can be a genuine benefit to any readers who may ultimately consider doing this type of travel themselves, or anyone who can simply find solace in knowing another soul is out there using any means necessary to cope with illness and difficulty in their lives.

I plan to stay with locals as much as possible, through couchsurfing, hostels, friends, and any other means, I want to learn the cultures, interact with the people, find the hidden gems, and let my backers see, and hear from the locals, for those that cannot travel for whatever reason, they can live their dreams through my blogs, for those that have travelled, they can give me advice, and for those that have immigrated, they can help me out when I am in their native land. I believe it will be an education beyond what any institution could provide, and with this new found knowledge I would like to share it in as many ways possible, perhaps through a "YouTube”. I hope I reach my goal, as it's the only way I could really afford this dream, and that I am able to share it with you every step of the way.

story:
Short Summary

  • A little bit about the me the author.

    My name is Ian Hughes.  I found my passion for writing back in the summer of 2012. Although creative and imaginary with my works, I have been writing stories since I was told off at school to what I can and cannot write in a story.  I decided to ignore my teacher and wrote whatever came from my heart without any boundaries.  Currently writing for both children and adults in various fields including children's books, published poetry and also the paranormal to which I have a keen interest.   I want you to feel and experience how I feel in the stories and accounts which I am telling as though you were there with me.

    Having had a cancer scare back in the summer of 2014 which placed my books and ideas on the back burner for a while, this enabled me to re-think my stories and give them the passion I think they deserve and thinks you as the reader will love for many years to come.

  • The campaign funding is for marketing and getting me across the United Kingdom and in to schools, children's hospitals and book signing events in and around the UK.  Further funding over my threshold would enable me to provide 10% of the over funding to be given to Bleakholt Animal Sanctuary in Greater Manchester.  I have a dog from here who aptly named him Bolt because he is super fast :) If we somehow manage to over fund for a trip to the US to promote my book would be absolutely amazing and hopefully see some of you kind people at a book signing.  If we are so successful that some crazy billionaire likes my project and gives me an amazing amount to use then this will be used for a website to promote the characters and maybe a gaming app for your phone too.  I have so many ideas, so many things to think about that I think it is amazing.
  • With your funding I hope to make peoples lives that little bit more fun and to spread the word that no matter who you are or what background you are from that everyone has a little story to tell.  I would love for Zeki and the Space Cadets to become more than just a book, I think it would be a great idea for the book to become a children's cartoon, have a toy range and maybe more.  You are the people who can make this dream become a reality for me and for us.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As outlined above, the funding will enable me to travel the width and breath of the United Kingdom no matter how far or how awkward it is for me to get there. I think it would be a nice touch for me to be able to read to children who are ill and are finding life difficult at the moment.  I am quite a shy person and I think with this experience it will enable me to grow as a person and feel good that I am giving some happiness to children across the United Kingdom and who knows America (hopefully)  The funding will be used to purchase my book which goes to print in June and bring along with me on the journey.  I may sell a few, I may sell one.  If I sell one and they enjoy it then I am happy.  It's all about making the right choices to make Zeki and the Space Cadets a success I feel it deserves.
  • The perks are for your benefit, I will try and be as concise in what you will get for your amazing contributions, once you have read my book pass it on to a friend.  Pass it on to someone who doesn't have much in this world and donate it, even donate it to your local library.
  • If I don't reach my target, that is okay, I will have to downscale the Countrywide book tour, dependant on what the outcome brings whatever the amount of funding is provided be sure that it will be spent on marketing my book and getting it out there as much as I humanly can.

The Impact

  • I feel my project on Zeki and the Space Cadets can be valuable as it teaches kids and even young adults what it is like to grow up in a world of bullying, war and sadness, but gives enough hope that no matter what happens around us, the world can be one amazing place to be.  If I am lucky enough to get enough funding to provide my book to the third world and bring hope and joy through reading and learning then I feel I have done something right in my life.  It's all about giving.
  • My book will be published and printed by June, if I am able to speed up this time frame and I get my book launched before this time I will be sure you will be getting the perk you have paid for in a timely manner.  I will give constant updates on the project and advise any issues I have but be sure I always deliver. Like I used to say when I sold items on eBay, you are the people who drive a business to success.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • There are challenges to making my book successful, I work full time and have a young son who I see during the week and at weekends.  I have read Zeki and the Space Cadets the undrafted version to him at bedtime and he loves it.  I will have to make occasional sacrifices if I want this book to be successful since when I go to book signings and to charities and hospitals to read I will have to take my son occasionally on these journeys but that is a fact of life and I am sure I am not the only person who has this dilemma as a single dad.  I won't be able to take my son all the time across the country and some times it will be too far for him to go.  To be a single father who wants success for his book it will be hard going, but I promise you when I go on the book tours etc that I will always be home to have my son and be a responsible father dependant on how far I have to travel from.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to donate, that is okay, please get the word out for me that Zeki and the Space Cadets are coming and they are going to save the World and make it a fun and happy place to be.  Tell it on social media, tell it to your friends and family, policemen, radio presenters.  I think its a wonderful story and should be told for generations to come.  Who knows, if after the first book is launched and there is a demand for a second then I don't see why I cannot follow up with a second book within the year :)  Remember, Indiegogo uses share tools, use these, copy and paste my funding platform and make a difference!

And that's all there is to it.

Oh and before I go, you guys need to at least read the synopsis so here goes:

Synopsis

The year is 2150, the Galaxy is a haven for Alien pirate Ninja Squirrels, but one planet 'Earth' is still holding out against the dreaded General Cussler and his group of bandit Alien Ninja Squirrels. The planets only hope against these impending invaders are a group of young spritely space cadets, a team of boys and girls aged between the ages of 7-16, training in the arts of monkey kung-fu and Cat-Kwon-Do and with the technical knowledge in operating the new special ‘C’ shaped fighter spacefighter.

That hope is fading fast, as the days and nights of fighting and the spread of war gets more and more intense and the battles fiercer one boy dreams of becoming a space cadet and follow in his families footsteps to fight the evil in the Galaxy and make the Universe a safer place.

Our adventurer on this journey is an eight year old smart but shy boy, his companion on his adventure is a five year old talking tabby cat 'Muffin'. He wants to become the youngest cadet in the family and join the Earth cadet elite and while searching for his abducted mother and to honour his father who sadly was squashed in an attack by a giant spider-bear rampage back on the exo-planet Banjospider 9 while fighting for freedom in the Mutant Fish wars of 2139-2146.

Zeki knows that something inside him urges him to fight for freedom and push for the saviour of the planet, the galaxy and possibly the Universe. Not even he knows his true destiny.

There had been a disturbance in the little town of Loopyluna Villa in the heart of England where he, his mother and Milkshake the talking dog live.

This is where our story begins.

Follow Zeki in the first part of his quest to become a space cadet and his adventures in space while confronting the evil General Cussler with his band of Alien Ninja Squirrel bandits and Mutant slave army and to save the Galaxy and Earth from total annihilation.

Good luck cadets!

Signing off.

Commander Ian Hughes

story:
We're raising money to have our book, Battle Sites, translated from Danish into English.

The book in Denmark

In 2014, Informationsforlag published the book Battle Sites - Kamppladser in Danish. The book tells the story of the Danish labour movement's struggle against social dumping in the 10 years that elapsed since the EU's eastern expansion began on the first of May 2004. Accompanied by analyses and statistics, the book describes some of the most spectacular battles that took place on six specific construction sites. 

Throughout the book, we keep the spotlight on who is behind the dumping. Not the poor Eastern European workers who are trying to earn a little more than they are used to back home, but a mixture of small time profiteers and powerful businessmen who exploit the system. However, none of the characters in the book are one dimensional. Polish migrants, union activists and businessmen alike are portrayed as they are: as people of both good and evil.

The authors

The authors of Battle Sites are not impartial historians, but on the contrary, active participants in the struggles. Jakob Mathiassen is a concrete worker and activist of his local  3F trade union. He has taken part in the struggle since the beginning. Klaus Buster Jensen is a journalist for 3F's trade journal, and he has exposed and reported on social dumping in Denmark's construction trade.

The fight is European 

Everywhere in Europe today, construction workers as well as transportation workers, agriculture workers, and many many more, are fighting against the consequences of social dumping. National labour movements and political parties fight as best they can against social dumping in their respective countries. Seldom are their common experiences ever exchanged and compared, and when they are, only inch by inch do the conclusions reach union members and activists. We believe it's time we shared our experiences more fluidly from country to country. This is why we are working on translating our book Battle Sites into English. Our hope is that the Danish experience, victories, and failures, can be used in the struggle against social dumping all over Europe.

The money 

The book was originally published independent of the Danish trade union movement, to ensure the book's independence. Now we are trying to raise money from many different sources, including the trade union movement. You can donate through this crowd funding, or through direct contributions to our account. We are also raising money for a German translation in German-speaking countries. The money will go to the translation and publication of the book. We are not collecting money for the authors.

The critics said:

”Battle-Sites show cases the absurdities with liberating and disturbing clarity, but also elemental suspense, and it is a difficult book to put down. We get the broad underlying political perspectives clearly described, and we get a brutal close-up of the many battles upfront and behind the scenes." 

Review by Rune Engelbreth Larsen. Published in Denmark's largest dailynewspaper Politiken , the 6/3 2014

"The book is not uplifting reading. It paints a clear picture of a trade union that with the current methods has its back against the wall. (..) Whether the book will be a epitaph of the unions struggle, or launch a new debate on the future approaches in the fight against social dumping is up to you - the future readers of Battle Sites." 

Review by former president of the national scaffolding workers club Thorkil Jansen. Published in the leftwing paper The Worker, 5/3 2014.


Read the full review and more on our facebook´s notes.

has taken part in the struggle since the beginning. Klaus Buster
Jensen is a journalist for 3F's trade journal, and he has exposed
and reported on social dumping in Denmark's construction trade.The fight is European 

Everywhere in Europe today, construction workers as well as
transportation workers, agriculture workers, and many many more, are
fighting against the consequences of social dumping. National labour
movements and political parties fight as best they can against social
dumping in their respective countries. Seldom are their common
experiences ever exchanged and compared, and when they are, only inch
by inch do the conclusions reach union members and activists. We
believe it's time we shared our experiences more fluidly from country
to country. This is why we
are working on translating our book Battle Sites into English. Our hope is that the Danish experience, victories, and
failures, can be used in the struggle against social dumping all over Europe.

The money The book was originally published independent of the Danish trade union movement, to ensure the book's independence. Now we are trying to raise money from many different sources, including the trade union movement. You can donate through this crowd funding, or through direct contributions to our account. We are also raising money for a German translation in German-speaking countries. The money will go to the translation and publication of the book. We are not collecting money for the authors.The critics said:”Battle-Sites show cases the absurdities with liberating and disturbing clarity, but also elemental suspense, and it is a difficult book to put down. We get the broad underlying political perspectives clearly described, and we get a brutal close-up of the many battles upfront and behind the scenes." Review by Rune Engelbreth Larsen. Published in Denmark's largest dailynewspaper Politiken , the 6/3 2014"The book is not uplifting reading. It paints a clear picture of a trade union that with the current methods has its back against the wall. (..) Whether the book will be a epitaph of the unions struggle, or launch a new debate on the future approaches in the fight against social dumping is up to you - the future readers of Battle Sites." Review by former president of the national scaffolding workers club Thorkil Jansen. Published in the leftwing paper The Worker, 5/3 2014.Read the full review and more on our facebook´s notes.

story:
Iterate Often

Hack the Union started as a bootstrapped project--basically, I spent a bunch of months working as a consultant, and used some of the money from my consulting for the first year's worth of stories. I wanted to be able to hire some other folks to write for the site--with a particular focus on hiring writers of color, and folks who could write about organizing that was happening outside of DC and New York, or about organizing that went beyond responding to our present moment to look at what was coming down the road in 10 or 15 years. 

A lot has changed for me, personally, since I launched this site. I went from having a half-time job and a consulting gig to being a full-time consultant, and back to having a full-time job. Particularly since returning to work full-time, I've struggled to maintain regular posting of my own, much less having the ability to manage writers. 

Some folks have been kind enough to support us on Patreon, and I really appreciate that funding. But it only comes in when we have an original post up (ie--the weekly newsletter doesn't trigger contributions), and that can be infrequent. If you're already contributing on Patreon--don't worry, I'm not asking you for more money. And thank you, for being an early supporter!

At this point, I'm honestly conflicted about whether it makes sense for us to continue trying to put out original reporting. And so I'm coming to you, the audience, to tell me what you want to see. 


The Goal

The goal of this campaign is to raise $6,000, which basically covers two pieces of original reporting a month for a year. If we don't reach that goal, we'll use whatever money comes in to run for this year.

Right now, we pay $250 per post for regular writers, and $75 per post for guest writers. Your freelance writing folks will tell you, that's higher than most online sites pay. But this site is about economic justice, especially in the new economy. It would be kind of messed up to pay people peanuts. 

All the money that is raised will be used to pay writers. The infrastructure costs, such as they are, will continue to be paid for by me. I don't pay myself for work on the site--I have a good-paying job, and I'd rather spend the money that's raised on funding writers. 


If You're Gonna Fail, Fail Fast

It's certainly possible that all of you out there don't care that much for the original reporting that this site has produced, or share my vision of a site that isn't telling you the same stories you can find in other parts of the labor press. In that case, I'll stop trying to make fetch happen, and just focus on finding you more links about robots, or snarky stories about Uber.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution, please think about helping by expanding the reach of HtU--or this post, using the share tools. I always love to get those notifications that someone new has signed up for the newsletter--because I know it means someone out there has forwarded it to a friend, and their friend liked it too.

story:
IF YOU HAD THE OPPORTUNITY TO CHANGE A CHILD'S LIFE...WOULD YOU DO IT? 



Brooklyn Borough President, Eric Adams is a Fatherless Like Me supporter!  He is excited about the book series and will lend a hand to help us promote it!  Will you help out too?


Well here's your chance...purchase a book or donate money and help us offer hope and healing to fatherless children all over the globe 'one book at a time'.


"Help us raise $10,000 to complete our 'Fatherless Like Me' book series.  Our books help to shed light on a very dark subject and bring new hope to fatherless children all over the world!" -  Tonia Grady

                                      

                                         3 WAYS THAT YOU CAN HELP

  1. Donate $$$ to help us complete the 'Fatherless Like Me' book series
  2. Purchase a copy of "Fatherless Like Me: Growing Up Without Dad'
  3. Pre-order 'Fatherless Like Me II: Reunited With My Dad

       DONATE NOW!!!               DONATE NOW!!!              DONATE NOW!!!

                                     

                       

Be sure to check out the perks on the right column


'FATHERLESS LIKE ME' is a wonderfully crafted inspiring children's book series -- that triumphs over the difficulties of fatherlessness with heart, faith and soul! 

First-time authors', Skylar and her mother, Tonia Grady teamed up to write the 'Fatherless Like Me' book series.  The  books reveal a bittersweet tale about a little girl from Brooklyn named Skylar, who is growing up without her dad.  She's a fun-loving kid that enjoys learning, riding her rip-stick and playing basketball.  The books reveal intimate segments of Skylar's life, and captures her personal journey as a fatherless kid.  'Fatherless Like Me: Growing Up Without Dad' was the first book (published in 2012) of the three-part series. 

This mother and daughter writing duo used a cup of real life, a pinch of fiction, a dash of fantasy and a layer of fun as the ingredients for this powerful little book series.  The reality is…life without dad is hard for Skylar, and she has to learn to deal with the pain and sadness she feels.  The books provide teachable moments, that will help other kids learn how to work through their feelings about missing their father.




The books are colorful, fun and uplifting!  The spirited characters that almost leap  off the page -- have become fan favorites with the readers.  'Fatherless Like Me' is a great resource for moms, estranged fathers, school administrators and teachers.   It's also a great springboard to start the conversation and help kids open up about their feelings concerning dad.


"Hi, my name is Tonia Grady, and Skylar is my 12 year old daughter.  We are the proud authors of the 'Fatherless Like Me' book series.  One book published...two more to go!  Your donation will help us complete our "Fatherless Like Me' book series - dedicated to uplifting fatherless children all of the globe!"


We are excited about our next book 'Fatherless Like Me II: Reunited With My Dad'.   We really hope you embrace our honesty as we share our personal story!
                    

"The Fatherless Like Me book series has truly been a labor of love for me and my daughter!  We are happy to share our story , connect with other kids and single moms who may be going through the same struggles."    - Tonia Grady                                                       


                     FATHERLESS LIKE ME II: REUNITED WITH MY DAD


The 2nd book 'Fatherless Like Me II:Reunited With My Dad', picks up where the first book left off...with Skylar getting an unexpected visit from her father! The books were emotionally challenging to write, but proved quite healing for both Skylar and her mother.  They are committed to finishing what they started -- getting this important message of hope & healing to children all around the world.  And no longer wanting to delay publishing the two books any longer because of financial restraints; A decision was made to ask for help.  Thus the reason for this crowd-funding campaign.

                                                                                   

                           

                          1 in 3 children in the US 

                  are growing up without a father! 


"Go on sugar and make a donation or buy a book...do it for Ms. Sophie!"


Grab Some Of Our Cool Products Before they're Gone!


                                            Ms. Sophie Galaxy S5 Phone Case                                                      

                                       

                          


Where does the money go?

Self publishing is very expensive!  Add in the fact that the books are beautifully  illustrated, with lots of color and the printing costs practically doubles. 

The money that is raised will go towards paying the very talented graphic designer.  The book covers and almost every page in the books, has incredible artwork and illustrations that brings the story to life!  The remainder of the money will be used to print the books and have them shipped.

Tonia and Skylar were extremely proud that they were successful in publishing the first book in 'Fatherless Like Me' series in 2012.  The money that is generated from the book sales -- goes directly back into printing more books.  They really want to complete the 'Fatherless Like Me' book series, but they can sure use a little help! 


                           ********************

Dedicated to uplifting the spirits of fatherless kids

Tonia and Skylar are very community driven!  They spend most of their time engaging with fatherless children, single moms and fatherhood programs.  Making appearances, doing book reading and signings at various schools, churches and after school programs all over the NY Tri-state area.

"We received rave reviews from fans and our first book 'Fatherless Like Me: Growing Up Without Dad' has literally changed lives!  How do we know this?  We get our data straight from the horses mouth!  We've had moms, dads and children, tell us how much they love the book and the characters.  We've had single moms breakdown crying because the book was able to reach their child in a way that they could not.  Surprisingly, fathers' who were estranged from their kids have embraced the book, and understand why it's so important to reconnect with their children." - Says, Tonia Grady  


                              'FATHERLESS LIKE ME' MAKES THE NEWS!!! 

We were featured in the Amsterdam News, and we were featured on Brooklyn Independent Television's Neighborhood Beat show (video clip at top).


Neighborhood Beat TV Show Feature on authors' Tonia & Skylar Grady


In addition to other local exposure, we landed a feature spot on the nationally syndicated Tom Joyner Morning Show segment "Inside Here Story with Jacque Reid".  Click the link below to hear interview:

http://blackamericaweb.com/73869/jacque-reid-goes-inside-her-story-with-tonia-grady/2/


Meet Skylar...

Skylar graduated Summa Cum Laude from elementary school!  She's 12 years old, she loves learning, writing and play basketball.


More about Tonia Grady....


Ms. Grady, also known as Gradygirl, is an entrepreneur, television producer, independent filmmaker and author.  In 2007, Tonia produced and directed a independent documentary film titled, "Man-Up: The Exploration of a Fatherless Nation".  Ms. Grady is recognized as a pioneer in the fatherhood movement because of her film, Man-Up was the first of its kind. The film was very well received, and earned Tonia many awards and accolades.  Because Ms. Grady is so passionate about her work of connect broken families and helping fatherless children; She took her film on the road with a 10-city tour, so she could be up close and personal with her viewing audience.  This move proved to be priceless and helped Man-Up documentary to become a huge underground phenomenon!


                                            MAN-UP DOCUMENTARY CLIP


             
                MAN UP DOCUMENTARY SCREENING IN NEWARK, NJ




'Fatherless Like Me: Growing Up Without Dad' book is available online now at the official site: www.fatherlesslikeme.com. The book sells for $9.99 plus tax and shipping and handling.  You can also purchase the Man-Up Documentary at www.manupthedocumentary.com.

story:
THE MAGAZINE

TERRE DI CONFINE è un’associazione culturale non profit, costituitasi nel 2010 con la finalità di studiare, promuovere e diffondere la cultura, le scienze e l’arte – quest’ultima con particolare riferimento ai generi letterari Fantascienza e Fantastico e all’Animazione Giapponese – intese sotto ogni loro forma espressiva (www.terrediconfine.eu/statuto/). L’Associazione pubblica Terre di Confine Magazine, rivista progettata e realizzata dalla Redazione TdC. È un magazine in pdf che si occupa di fantascienza, fantasy, fantastico in generale, in tutte le loro declinazioni; è completamente gratuita, sfogliabile on-line e scaricabile dal sito dell’Associazione, dalla piattaforma ISSUU, da Google Play e da numerosi e-book store italiani (stiamo inoltre lavorando a una versione da poter rendere disponibile in Amazon). Terre di Confine Magazine ha attualmente al suo attivo 5 numeri (l’ultimo è uscito il 3 maggio di quest’anno) ognuno con circa 240 pagine (senza alcun tipo di inserto pubblicitario).

TERRE DI CONFINE is a cultural, non-profit organization founded in 2010 with the purpose of studying, promoting and spreading culture, science and art – including, but not limited to, Science Fiction & Fantasy literature and Japanese Anime (www.terrediconfine.eu/statuto/). Terre di Confine Magazine is a free magazine designed and produced by our editorial staff in pdf format. Its content can be viewed online and downloaded from the Association's website, the ISSUU platform, Google Play and many Italian e-book stores. The magazine will soon be available to Amazon users as well. With its about 240 pages (and no advertising), the magazine, currently at issue #5 (released on May 3, 2016), aims to offer the readers a keen insight into the world of science fiction and fantasy.

READ IT HERE: https://issuu.com/terrediconfine/docs/tdcm005

Ci siamo impegnati per conferire a Terre di Confine Magazine una grafica moderna e originale, riservando gran cura all’impaginazione e alla qualità dei testi. A corredo: immagini concesse alla nostra rivista da artisti di tutto il mondo. L’intenzione è di offrire uno strumento di divulgazione serio e indipendente, che tratti i temi del fantastico nei loro aspetti artistici, storici e culturali, con onestà intellettuale e rispetto del lettore, promuovendo al contempo l’operato di tutti coloro che si dedicano a questo mondo affascinante: autori, illustratori, disegnatori, fotografi, artisti visuali. I contenuti spaziano principalmente nei seguenti campi della cultura e dell’intrattenimento...

We have done our best to give Terre di Confine Magazine a most modern and original graphic style. Layout and texts are accurately selected and accompanied by images supplied by illustrators from all around the world. We intend to offer our readers a professional, independent experience addressing many of the artistic, historical and cultural themes of the fantasy genre, while promoting the work of editors, illustrators, designers, photographers, visual artists and all those devoted to this fascinating world. At the same time we remain fully committed to our intellectual integrity and the respect for our readers.

Here are Terre di Confine Magazine main topics:

LITERATURE

MOVIES

TV SERIES

ANIME/CARTOONS

COMICS

ART

PHOTOGRAPHY

COSPLAY

Una sezione antologica conclude ogni numero proponendo i migliori racconti fantastici inediti, scelti dal nostro comitato di selezione.

An anthology section placed on the last pages of each issue features the best unpublished horror, fantasy, sci-fi and weird tales selected by our committee.

Si tratta di un lavoro redazionale complesso e impegnativo, ma il nostro team si propone oggi un obbiettivo ancor più ambizioso: raddoppiare in 18 mesi il numero delle uscite, realizzare quindi altri 5 numeri entro dicembre del 2017. E al contempo incrementare i contenuti del sito web (http://www.terrediconfine.eu/). Per riuscire a completare questo progetto in un lasso di tempo così ristretto, chiediamo il sostegno di tutti coloro che hanno apprezzato la nostra attività. Anche il più piccolo aiuto sarà per noi prezioso!

The editorial work is very complex and demanding, but our dynamic staff set themselves a new, even more ambitious challenge: to double up our releases in the next 18 months, that is 5 more issues of our magazine by December 2017. At the same time, we wish to expand the contents of our website (http://www.terrediconfine.eu/). In order to achieve this project in such a small timeframe we ask the support of all those who appreciate our work. Even the smallest contribution will be priceless to us!

TO OUR SUPPORTERS

Come attestato di gratitudine, ogni donatore che vorrà supportarci verrà accreditato come produttore nei 5 numeri della rivista (a meno che non preferisca rimanere anonimo). A coloro che doneranno più di 150 euro (circa 170 dollari) verrà inoltre inviata l’esclusiva Polo tecnica dry-tech “I love Terre di Confine Magazine".

Unless they prefer to remain anonymous, our supporters will be credited as producers and their names mentioned in the five issues to be released. As a thank-you gesture, those who will contribute with 170 Dollars or more will also be rewarded with our exclusive dry-tech polo shirt “I love Terre di Confine Magazine".

CREDITS

Esprimiamo la nostra riconoscenza tutti gli artisti che hanno voluto aiutarci gratuitamente nella realizzazione dei primi 5 numeri. Li elenchiamo di seguito (in ordine alfabetico), con rinnovata stima e gratitudine.

Our most heartfelt thank you to all the artists (listed below in alphabetical order) who devoted themselves to the magazine and allowed us to publish their works for free. To each of them goes our deepest appreciation and gratitude.

Illustrators

  • Aaron Sutherland • australia

story_txt:
THE MAGAZINE
 TERRE DI CONFINE è un’associazione culturale non profit, costituitasi nel 2010 con la finalità di studiare, promuovere e diffondere la cultura, le scienze e l’arte – quest’ultima con particolare riferimento ai generi letterari Fantascienza e Fantastico e all’Animazione Giapponese – intese sotto ogni loro forma espressiva (www.terrediconfine.eu/statuto/).
L’Associazione pubblica Terre di Confine Magazine, rivista progettata e realizzata dalla Redazione TdC. È un magazine in pdf che si occupa di fantascienza, fantasy, fantastico in generale, in tutte le loro declinazioni; è completamente gratuita, sfogliabile on-line e scaricabile dal sito dell’Associazione, dalla piattaforma ISSUU, da Google Play e da numerosi e-book store italiani (stiamo inoltre lavorando a una versione da poter rendere disponibile in Amazon). Terre di Confine Magazine ha attualmente al suo attivo 5 numeri (l’ultimo è uscito il 3 maggio di quest’anno) ognuno con circa 240 pagine (senza alcun tipo di inserto pubblicitario).
 TERRE DI CONFINE is a cultural, non-profit organization founded in 2010 with the purpose of studying, promoting and spreading culture, science and art – including, but not limited to, Science Fiction & Fantasy literature and Japanese Anime (www.terrediconfine.eu/statuto/).
Terre di Confine Magazine is a free magazine designed and produced by our editorial staff in pdf format. Its content can be viewed online and downloaded from the Association's website, the ISSUU platform, Google Play and many Italian e-book stores. The magazine will soon be available to Amazon users as well. With its about 240 pages (and no advertising), the magazine, currently at issue #5 (released on May 3, 2016), aims to offer the readers a keen insight into the world of science fiction and fantasy.


READ IT HERE: https://issuu.com/terrediconfine/docs/tdcm005
 Ci siamo impegnati per conferire a Terre di Confine Magazine una grafica moderna e originale, riservando gran cura all’impaginazione e alla qualità dei testi. A corredo: immagini concesse alla nostra rivista da artisti di tutto il mondo. L’intenzione è di offrire uno strumento di divulgazione serio e indipendente, che tratti i temi del fantastico nei loro aspetti artistici, storici e culturali, con onestà intellettuale e rispetto del lettore, promuovendo al contempo l’operato di tutti coloro che si dedicano a questo mondo affascinante: autori, illustratori, disegnatori, fotografi, artisti visuali.
I contenuti spaziano principalmente nei seguenti campi della cultura e dell’intrattenimento...

 We have done our best to give Terre di Confine Magazine a most modern and original graphic style. Layout and texts are accurately selected and accompanied by images supplied by illustrators from all around the world. We intend to offer our readers a professional, independent experience addressing many of the artistic, historical and cultural themes of the fantasy genre, while promoting the work of editors, illustrators, designers, photographers, visual artists and all those devoted to this fascinating world. At the same time we remain fully committed to our intellectual integrity and the respect for our readers.
Here are Terre di Confine Magazine main topics:
LITERATURE

MOVIES

TV SERIES

ANIME/CARTOONS

COMICS

ART

PHOTOGRAPHY

COSPLAY

 Una sezione antologica conclude ogni numero proponendo i migliori racconti fantastici inediti, scelti dal nostro comitato di selezione.
 An anthology section placed on the last pages of each issue features the best unpublished horror, fantasy, sci-fi and weird tales selected by our committee.


 Si tratta di un lavoro redazionale complesso e impegnativo, ma il nostro team si propone oggi un obbiettivo ancor più ambizioso: raddoppiare in 18 mesi il numero delle uscite, realizzare quindi altri 5 numeri entro dicembre del 2017. E al contempo incrementare i contenuti del sito web (http://www.terrediconfine.eu/).
Per riuscire a completare questo progetto in un lasso di tempo così ristretto, chiediamo il sostegno di tutti coloro che hanno apprezzato la nostra attività. Anche il più piccolo aiuto sarà per noi prezioso!
 The editorial work is very complex and demanding, but our dynamic staff set themselves a new, even more ambitious challenge: to double up our releases in the next 18 months, that is 5 more issues of our magazine by December 2017. At the same time, we wish to expand the contents of our website (http://www.terrediconfine.eu/).
In order to achieve this project in such a small timeframe we ask the support of all those who appreciate our work. Even the smallest contribution will be priceless to us!


TO OUR SUPPORTERS
 Come attestato di gratitudine, ogni donatore che vorrà supportarci verrà accreditato come produttore nei 5 numeri della rivista (a meno che non preferisca rimanere anonimo). A coloro che doneranno più di 150 euro (circa 170 dollari) verrà inoltre inviata l’esclusiva Polo tecnica dry-tech “I love Terre di Confine Magazine".
 Unless they prefer to remain anonymous, our supporters will be credited as producers and their names mentioned in the five issues to be released. As a thank-you gesture, those who will contribute with 170 Dollars or more will also be rewarded with our exclusive dry-tech polo shirt “I love Terre di Confine Magazine".




CREDITS
 Esprimiamo la nostra riconoscenza tutti gli artisti che hanno voluto aiutarci gratuitamente nella realizzazione dei primi 5 numeri. Li elenchiamo di seguito (in ordine alfabetico), con rinnovata stima e gratitudine.

story:
FIT FOR JOY: The Book

Fitness of the Heart

The Fit For Joy book will inspire and empower those who believe they can start their own movement toward REAL healthy changes. Valeria's life is devoted to practices and creative ideas that can lead us back to our hearts. 

The is about the journey of self-exploration and self-love. 

It's about living an authentic life guided by the heart. The untold story about fitness, strength, love, health, joy and courage.

Proceeds of the book will be used to build and fund the Fit for Joy center - a facility that will provide a charity, fitness center project devoted to total well-being. The aim is to bring forth the power of love within.

 

OPENING CHAPTER

In my late thirties, I became a certified personal trainer and winning fitness competitor. This was an exciting time in my life. I was healthy and in the best shape ever. I had come a long way to be where I was. Most people admired my fit body, strength, and enthusiasm for fitness. What they didn't know was that there was a secret about me...

 

THE BOOK IS FOR ANYONE WHO...

  • Feels the call to express their truth in the heart. 
  • Knows we are born to be joyful and healthy as a whole: body, mind and heart! 
  • Is aware that to love is why we are here but hasn't found a way to open the heart and express it. 
  • Is anxious and depressed living a life that doesn't fit the soul, and is searching for self-development and spiritual growth. 

 

 

FIT FOR JOY PRESENTS AND OFFERS...

  • A holistic approach to fitness through creative and spiritual practices for the experience of self-knowledge, health and joy. 
  • Personal true stories of a heart in search of true expression – the challenges, the triumphs, the love, the wonder, the joy. Strength training in a program of spiritual growth. 
  • Ideas of how romantic relationships can become a door to spirituality. 
  • The Fit for Joy Fitness Center – a project in progress which readers will be contributing to its realization. 
  • The importance of using your creativity to connect with the deepest part of yourself.
  •  The vital importance of living a life guided by the heart.  
  • You will be able to identify the connection between fear, anxiety, unhealthy habits and the matters of the heart.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

 

"THE SNOWFLAKE"  SAMPLE  STORY 

FIT FOR JOY: The Center Project

 

The Fit for Joy Center is a project that relates to the ideas and practices presented in this book. It is devoted to physical, spiritual fitness and creative practices aiming to bring forth the life force within the human heart. It espouses fitness, healthy eating, soul expression, meaningful creative works, ideas and training.

The staff will be made up of volunteers who stand for a life of authenticity guided by the heart. They can be personal trainers, nutritionists, meditation teachers, chefs, yoga, and dance instructors, and of course, artists: writers, painters, musicians, poets, philosophers and others.

Book sales will help to build the first "fitness of the heart" space.

All early supporters and backers will be updated by email on the progress of center project. You are all part of this dream!

It will be a non-profit facility

"BRINGING TOGETHER WHAT WAS MEANT TO BE APART." 

MORE ABOUT THE CENTER HERE ​

 

HOW WILL FUNDS BE USED 

 

The funding goal is the amount we need to produce and print 250 copies. CreateSpace is working with us - An Amazon Distributor  - Services provided include copyediting, structure editing, black and white interior design, kindle conversion, paperback printing.  

Breakdown of costs:  

CreateSpace with Amazon Distribution: $2,868   //  Main Editor: $2,500 / Illustrator: $2,700 // D3 Architect - Center Images: $760. // Book Cover and e-Book Color Interior Design: $439. // Printing cost: x250 books = $1, 710 //Grand Total: $10.977

 

ADDITIONAL  FUNDS

The extra funds we get from you by exceeding funding goal we'll use on producing a full-color hardcover. We will also use on publicity to get the message out to as many hearts as possible. Any super extra contribution will go toward building our Fit for Joy Center!

 

HOW TO ORDER USING ANY CARD

Indiegogo accepts credit or debit card, not only Pay Pal, but uses it to proceed with your purchase.

Here is how to do it:

1. Select your perk.

2. Fill in your shipping information and select “Continue to Paypal.”You will not have to log in to Paypal or create a Paypal account.

3. Under “Choose a way to pay” on the Paypal screen, select “Pay with a credit or debit card.”

4. Fill in your card information and complete your purchase.

 

PERK DETAILS AND NOTES

1- $2. -  FROM THE HEART DONATION - A personalized "Thank You" by email.

2- $7. -  FIT FOR JOY DONATION - A personalized "Thank You" by email.

3- $11. -  E-BOOK  - Worldwide 

4- $22. - BOOK - Worldwide

5- $44. - BOOK and E-BOOK - Worldwide

6- $220. - CENTER DONATION - Worldwide 

** All PERKS INCLUDE: an invitation to be part of my Whatsup or Skype conversation group. Also, as an acknowledgment of your support I would love to post your name and/or headshot on my website. If you also would like this, please email your photo; by doing so, you'll be giving me permission to post and mention your name publicly. *Note:  Black and white illustrations for all copies.

** ILLUSTRATIONS: the sample illustration here is full-color but we can only print black and white on book for now. Extra funds will be used to produce full-color hardcover copies.

 

UPDATES 

I will be posting updates frequently here, on www.FITFORJOY.org and on both: FACEBOOK FIT FOR JOY BOOK and VALERIA TELES.

 

 MEET THE FIT FOR JOY TEAM

READ ABOUT THE TEAM and  MEET PRE-CAMPAIGN SUPPORTERS  

FIT FOR JOY BRAZIL 

 

FIT FOR JOY  IN FRANCE

"To follow the heart is an adventure of living a life that has been there for you all along."

When my heart felt like leaving New York to go somewhere else to do some rewriting and editing for Fit for Joy I sent a message to many of my friends all over the world. One of the first replies I got within minutes read:  "Yes and yes, you can stay in my house in Paris for as long as need to work on your book. My lovely friend ANA FREN has made my journey of writing my first book as spiritual and interesting as it could be!! Thank you again and again....!! :)

"WE CAN'T UNITE THAT WHICH WAS NEVER APART."

For someone who has been listening to the heart in health and love for all my life, to conclude the final pages of Fit for Joy in The City of Love and Lights, could just be a natural path, but beyond my wildest dreams!! 

The enchanting and transcendent romantic atmosphere of Paris will mark my journey as an author that will be reflected on the pages of this book.

Life is about the adventure of finding out who we really are. We must go where ever the heart takes us. Before landing in the City of Love and Lights, I made many other stops. The story I tell  will take you with me to all the cities of life I have been to. 

There is a marvelous and mysterious feeling that Fit for Joy has been carried and written within my being throughout life. It was born in New York, will be raised in France to become a citizen of the world! What is not to LOVE about life?!!! :)

I'll be in France from October 15th, 2016 to January 15th, 2017. THANK YOU for coming with me!  I will be updating you often, here and on social media. Follow me on Facebook.

 

PLEASE SHARE

It's important that this book and ideas get to everyone who believes in health, joy and love.

Let's create together a movement from the heart toward a thriving life in a more united world!! :) 

 

QUESTIONS?

Please visit www.fitforjoy.org, send an email to valeria@fitforjoy.org or info@fitforjoy.org.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Much love,

Valeria Teles 

I am a certified personal trainer and winning fitness competitor with more than 20 years in the fitness industry, both as a professional and an enthusiast. My background includes performance in dance and music. For the past two years, I have successfully presented Fit for Joy ideas and programs to clients and Meetup members in New York. This is my first book! :)

Is anxious and depressed living a life that doesn't fit the soul, and is searching for self-development and spiritual growth.
